review:
Thank you Mr Anime connoisseur Joey Bizinger for this game. Your videos on this game might be old but I just had to get this game to see all the routes and dialogue.
The only Gripe I have is that there aren't enough static pictures but I enjoyed it and I'm one of those heathens that hate these types of games. So basically I loved this game and you should get it if you want short but fun experience, totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053656526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1673811538}
review:
Contexte d'achat :
Il est clair qu'Higschool Romance n'est pas vraiment mon style de jeu... Comment ce fait-il donc qu'il soit dans ma biblioth√®que....? M√™me moi je me pose encore la question en vrais... Lorsque j'ai voulu am√©liorer mon badge Subnautica en fusionnant les cartes steam, j'ai remarqu√© que l'on obtenait des bons de r√©duction de 66%. Parmi les quelques bons de ce type que j'ai obtenus, il n'y avait que Higschool Romance de "potable" on va dire... Et comme je voulais tester cette m√©canique, que je n'avais jamais essay√© auparavant, j'ai pris celui l√†. Bien sur ensuite, √©tant perfectionniste et ayant pay√© mon jeu, malgr√© la forte r√©duction, je l'ai tout de m√™me test√© et fini.

Verdict :
Alors... Hmmm... Que dire XD... Je crois que c'est assez compliqu√© pour moi de juger de ce genre de jeu, n'y √©tant pas tr√®s habitu√©. Je crois que le plus simple serait de r√©sumer mes quelques impression par ceci : Pour six moments "Haha" (que je qualifierait √©galement de moment agr√©ablement dr√¥les voir humoristiques), j'ai relev√© vingt quatre moments "Oskour" (que je qualifierait √©galement de moments cringes et malaisants)... Les moments malaisants relevaient d'une certaine situation de crosdressing du personnage principal, de r√©flexions sur le genre (heureusement jamais pouss√©es trop dans ce que je n'aime pas, cela aurait √©t√© red flag sinon...) et d'une certaine inclinaison de la principale du coll√®ge √† √™tre totalement d√©rang√©e XD (notamment vu son statut et celui de son √©l√®ve, ainsi que la diff√©rence d'age, de m√™me que pour son inclinaison prononc√©e pour les jeunes gar√ßons qui s'habillent en filles). Ironiquement et √ßa me fais bizarre de devoir l'admettre, c'est probablement la romance avec la principale qui est, il faut le reconna√Ætre, la plus... excitante des trois... Le jeu, dans son style, fait donc ce que l'on attend de lui en v√©rit√© et ce serait malhonn√™te de ma part d'en attendre plus, mais je pense que je m'abstiendrais de tester les recomandations de steams avec ces coupons hasardeux √† l'avenir XD.

Le mot de la fin :
"It's a trap !" (And I love Traps, that's why I recommand XD)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027442827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1663019802}
review:
Wordy silly gender-disguising bland romantic story.  The Sexual Content tag's pretty much a lie:  There's a couple of very tame and innocent bra-and-panty scenes.  That's all there is.

If you're super into cutsey romance, and don't mind a very meh linear story that is essentially just a gal-selector you might get some mileage out of it.

There's really nothing to it though.

De todos modos, el argumento no es nada nuevo. Los clich√©s no son nada nuevo. Y aunque el dise√±o es tierno, la historia a veces llega a ser muy poco para lo que esperas de un juego indie.

Pero bueno. ¬øRecomendarlo? Para pasar el rato si. Como fan de las novelas visuales desde Fate, Hakuouki, Starless, Danganronpa... Lo siento pero no doy mi visto bueno.

review:
Most negative reviews I read aren't wrong. 
Incredibly short. Few Options/Branches. Simple Premise. 

Be aware those are all true. 
It was an enjoyable bite-sized distraction and I caught it on sale :P
The idea of a male student attending an all-girl school (by various methods) is just like one of my Japanese animes. 
However it's western style is what got me.  
I feel like you can tell from the screenshots alone if this is something you'd wanna play and a review is just extra.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970072722', 'num_games_owned': 1285, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1614061652}
review:
This is an enjoyable visual novel, but it is extremely short with little in the way of interaction. And there is a dearth of artwork. The premise of the story is neat, but it is just underbaked due to how short the game is. As soon as the story gets going, it abruptly ends. And the whole premise is further undercut by this. I had hoped we could potentially see the character develop receptivity to being a crossdresser or even becoming a girl permanently. And with the lack of interactivity, there really isn't much to see. The lack of artwork is also a major negative. While the artwork is exceptional and very charming, there's not much of it at all. 

So while I recommend getting it, it is only if you can get it on steep discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198846387491', 'num_games_owned': 1088, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1612100734}
review:
One of the earlier VNs from the Dharker Studios. A brief slice of life, cross-dressing romance story with a sprinkle of comedy.

An initially forced cross-dressing at an all-girl school and some consequences of it serve as the main theme of this title. It's mainly a light slice of life romance within a typical school setting feeling similar to other stories of that type. Nothing unusual or surprising happens here. Writing is pretty straightforward but decent and I enjoyed it for the most part. This VN is short so there is little chance it will get boring before you finish it. Three different endings provide some replayability. 

The character art is hit or miss, I think. It has a distinct western character with a hint of anime style. I'm not a big fan of it but it has an ok quality. There are only a few charcter sprites and variations but it's reasonable considering the budget. Simple backgrounds and interface match the overall style.

Music is pretty standard and mostly fits the events. There were a few moments when I found the accompanying track a bit weird. I felt it was not matching the mood of a scene. No songs or voice acting here. Nothing really memorable either, just ok.

No issues encountered.

To summarize, a short, decently written slice of life at school story with some western style art and average music. It might be worth reading if that is your type. Can recommend: 5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093183804', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1611634251}
review:
Was bought this by someone for a joke once, played it to commit to the meme and surprisingly really enjoyed it. The game could do with some more art for different scenes and more expressions on the characters to make the game feel more alive, plus I mean it is quite short because I'm left hungry for more content.

Overall I liked the characters, the setting and basically all of the actual like story based stuff. Even if the premise is a bit weird, as a person in the Trans community it was really interesting playing a Shoji in their situation. My favourite has just gotta be Selina though, no questions asked.

TL;DR 7/10 Could use more art, more content, Selina best girl and a really enjoyable wholesome game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199109921434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1609823021}

author: {'steamid': '76561198360614668', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1609812101}
review:
its okay - buy it on sale though, i found it to be way too short for the full price, and im glad i bought it on sale...
a couple notes?
- all the characters are cute! i love the art and character design. im pretty sure i actually watched a lets play of this years ago, and the art and design have always stuck out to me. its very soft and pleasing to the eye.
- the ui, however, is more than a little tacky. i mean, the title screen looks like something out of a generic flash game... this isnt necessarily a bad thing, but its one of those things that makes the game feel a lot "cheaper" so to speak.
- i cannot for the life of me tell where this vn takes place. i mean, a lot of the scenery, the uniforms, the festival, "shoji" and "hoshi", make me think japan, but then weve got "selina" and the principal "lea rowen" and the fact that high school is four years long instead of three.
- i found the writing to be mostly progressive in terms of understanding things like gender identity, selina thinking shoji may be trans, etc., but having this as well as the semi-frequent "boys are innately stronger than girls", "it would be weird for a girl to like video games", etc. line of thinking felt kind of contradictory and off. i dunno, maybe i was reading too much into it, but it was very distracting to me.
- i think selina is the cutest girl! hoshi is cute, too! (shoji is the cutest boy!) the principal route felt awkward to me? idk
all in all its a short little vn that you may as well pick up on sale if youre bored and/or want to expand your visual novel collection. dont expect all that much substance from it or anything

author: {'steamid': '76561198076873743', 'num_games_owned': 5239, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1607933624}
review:
This is a good visual novel dating sim type of game.  I thought the art was really well done.  The music was good too.  I noticed two grammatical errors which isn't a big deal but I'm surprised it wasn't fixed by the developer.  Also it would have been nice if there were some CG without text at the bottom to take better screenshots.  

The protagonist gets sent to all girls school by accident.  He decides the best option is to fit in by cross-dressing his way throughout the school year.   There are 3 love interests that each have their own ending.  This game has many awkward and funny moments in it which is why I enjoyed it.  I recommend following the walkthrough in the guides section because that seemed to be the best way to get all 4 achievements going by how each ending turned out.

I would recommend picking this up if you like visual novels or dating sim type games.  I usually do not play these types of visual novels however I did find it fun.  Wait for a sale on this game because $13 is too much due to the games length and it gets bundled often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878921436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1596776462}
review:
I enjoyed this game and now that I've played through all the main story lines I feel like I can give it a proper review.  The most basic story isn't anything that hasn't been done before (A boy going to an all girls school and pretending to be a girl) but it does execute it very well.  One of the reviews I read had said that there were possible transgender components to the story but I wouldn't really go that far.  There is one discussion at one point about if the main character is trans* but their answer is no.  That's not a bad thing per say but I do feel like that review was misleading and since that factor had played a role in me deciding to purchase this game I felt it deserved to be mentioned.

Pros:
    -Quality graphics with well written text.  There are a few typos and grammatical errors but a lot fewer then normal visual novels.
    -Interesting and likable characters.  Most Visual Novels I've played have had at least one main character that I've had very little interest in interacting with but all of the characters in this one were ones that I wanted to interact with.
    -Mostly logical choices.  Yeah, I'll admit I had to check a completion guide occasionally especially in the beginning but I'd say that most of the choices you make actually made sense in context of the story.

Cons:
    -Only three characters to interact with.
    -Fairly short play through.  The first time through took me about 2 to 3 hours.  The second and third time through took significantly less, probably more like 30 minutes due to how much content is shared between the three different story lines.

So, in the end the game was cute, sweet and funny at times and well worth the 4 to 5 hours I spent on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988009757', 'num_games_owned': 1855, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1587635580}
review:
Quite a cute and sweet little story. Some very sexy stuff despite the lack of sex scenes. Love all 3 girls, in art and story. Adore the sexy flirty principal. I'd crossdress for someone like her in real life and I'm a cis man with no crossdressing fetish.

I only have 2 complaints - one is that the player character looks awful in most expression images but keeps getting complimented on his looks. The other is that the story's set up so that the player is one of the girls' only friend, and has to abandon her to pursue either of the others. Makes me feel guilty when I play the other routes.

Still, I frequently found myself with a big dumb smile on my face while playing, so I can overlook the faults and heartily give it a recommendation.

Also, it's my headcanon that the player character ends up in a poly relationship with all 3 girls, because there ain't no picking between them.

With regards to game play, or lack thereof, its your typical visual novel with interesting sexual choices and intertwined relationships that end up in one of a few ways that , after going through them all, would give you the achievements. review:
This game was a bit different from some of the other visual novels I've played, but it was honestly pretty good. Story was decent and it had multiple endings, visual style was unique and it really helped it stand out.
I wish more scenes were drawn out, art style attracted me the most after all. Music isn't anything to write home about, it's pretty generic and not memorable. There were some typos but nothing too distracting.
I'm not a huge fan of the 720p being highest supported resolution.
Price tag for this game is also a bit too much, but it IS a good game. Grab it on sale.

review:
Personalmente, no soy un √°vido jugador de las novelas visuales, he jugado unas pocas pero en esta ocasi√≥n, me he encontrado con algo curioso, diferente, la verdad, es, para mi algo fuera de lo com√∫n. Un chico que, por error, dir√≠a yo "administrativo" entra en un colegio de chicas; al no tener opci√≥n, mantiene un perfil diferente, convirti√©ndose en una "chica". 

Tiene un toque que, creo yo que, compensa las pocas melod√≠as existentes en el juego, pero, son muy bien empleadas. Es un juego entretenido, la historia es interesante. 

Personalmente, el √∫nico inconveniente, es el hecho de que casi todo el juego est√° desarrollado en un ambiente muy brillante, lo cual, la verdad, no lo recomiendo para aquellas personas que, como yo suele jugar en las noches, ya que, cansa demasiado la vista y puede llegar a deslumbrar bastante. Para poder obtener una mejor experiencia de juego, tuve que reducir los niveles de brillo y contraste a mi monitor, y para ser sincero, no fue suficiente. 

Buen juego 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197966946809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1580924135}
review:
Hate to do this, but I'm just gonna get straight to the point.  Game is C+ level at best.  No nudity/sex, and no "banging the principle", just a text implication at one point that you spend the night with her.  Multiple lazy scenes art-wise: characters say they will change, then simply re-appear with the same clothes.  Short game overall, with maybe 10 choices per playthrough (and some of the choices don't even make a difference, you are forced into situation A whether you chose A or B).  Story can be cute, but overall not much going on, and one of the 3 endings highly disappointed me. 

[spoiler] The girl has said before that she has been overt with her feelings towards you.  When you confess to having feelings for her she says something like "No I was just looking for a fling, but I guess now that you confess we can date". [/spoiler]
[spoiler] It was Selina. [/spoiler]

As bad as I feel doing this, I personally recommend against the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368099358', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1573279514}
review:
[h1] Highschool Romance [/h1] 

[b] A Promising VN That Takes No Risks, Goes Nowhere, And Ends Up Feeling Empty [/b]

This game was pretty disappointing. The premise sounded ridiculous, yet at least gave some potential for an interesting storyline filled with drama and secrecy. Instead, it ends up being a forgettable two hour story that play like many other visual novels. The whole game revolves around the premise of cross dressing in order to be able to attend an all-girls boarding school, and yet there is barely anything explored within the game. All that is discussed are stereotypes of girls, and the traditional anime-style schticks are shoved in for full effect: you have your older, authority-driven love interest; your nerdy bookworm love interest; and your athletic yet immature love interest. None of these characters are fleshed out, and the game serves as a cookie cutter visual novel masquerading as a more interesting, dramatic look at a wacky scenario. It left me pretty dissatisfied, and I would [b] Not Recommend [/b] many people to pick this this title up.

[h2] Final Verdict: 3/10 (Poor) [/h2]

If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my curator page for my thoughts on a variety of other games!

https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37542043-ADHD-Reviews/

author: {'steamid': '76561198211904603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1571725934}
review:
Note: I got this game as a gift from my friend!

PROS.
The game is really short and easy to beat. You can finish it in about 2 to 3 hours, if you were to read everything (excluding repeats). The characters are cute and it's your typical dating sim game. Honestly, this dating sim could be a lot better if there were more routes or if there were voices. The CGs were banging and I did grow to like the characters ;) (even if they were all annoying in their own way).

CONS.
Although the graphics and story line were decent, I felt like the price for this game is not worth it. Also, the story seemed a bit too rushed. I wished there was a gift giving mechanism incorporated or a bad end/normal end. It seemed too easy with how quickly you can get the girl and see them half-naked. I wanted there to be more of a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447581929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1570856393}
review:
While the graphics are cute and the storyline is so-so, there are some grammatical and spelling errors that could be easily updated with user input, and more variation of the environment and characters which are largely static in facial expression and clothing. It also would've been a nice twist to have this as a transfeminine realization rather than crossdressing male stereotype.

Would recommend only at sale price, and only as something to kill time while shipping it as yuri. You could probably beat everything in 3-6 hrs with actual reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388381323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1562433449}
review:
[b] Highschool Romance [/b]

Actually [b] High School Romance [/b].
Basically Its a graphic novel.
The story tells about a guy named Shogi ,who by misleading gets attended into a All-Girl Boarding School. (Yes the game plot touches Transsexual thematic to MY greatest surprize. I didnt know about it till I played it.) And while in there and pretending to be a girl she meets three, able to romance girls. [b] SELINA [/b] (All into sports blondie, always cheery and pokey) [b] HOSHI [/b] (The class rep. Brunette, glasses , modest and humble) and [b] LEA [/b] (a.k.a Mrs. Rowen, The Principal and most ''playful'' of all three.) It takes you through the story and to make the decision to which one you (Shoji) are going to end up with. Now that we've made the setting lemme tell you the [b] Pros [/b] and [b] Cons	[/b] of it.

[b] +PROS+[/b]
+)The setting is nice. The images and art of the game are pleasant to the eye.
+)The conversations and the characters arent boring, It really intrigued me to play further and find out whats gonna happen next
+)The pr0n element is minimal (This might be a con for you If youre a Hentai lova) and It all goes down to simple dress ups and making out. Tops.
+) (PERSONAL) As a transsexual myself, I really found the game... Cute. I enjoyed it.

[b]-CONS-[/b].
-) The plot is too ''naive''. The setting and the first act is waaay too similar to the plots from very ''famous genre''. This game definetly has it's targeted auditon. No competition between the ''dates'' for the main character. There is one between Selina and Hoshi... but its too light.
-) Plot is also very Linear. There might be totally 10 dialogue options within the whole game. and except the 3 different endings... the 2 of them (Selina and Hoshi) are almost identical, being like the opposites of each other. Lea is exclusive in this point.
-) Its too short for such price. I bought it with a coupon discount.. but still... Its too much.

Overall. 
Im happy with the purchase (feel a bit robbed) but still... I enjoyed this little story, the SETTING mostly and the characters. Never gonna forget them, and that 7 hours that Ive spent in this game. Happy with the purchase thats all.

and remember...
Always Bet On Blue.
Alice ‚ô£

author: {'steamid': '76561198201193771', 'num_games_owned': 3338, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1560697607}
review:
Highschool Romance is a decent Visual Novel with an intriguing Concept for its Story, as you play as a Guy that has to Crossdress so he can go to an All Girls School. There are 3 Love Interests which are all pretty cute, and the Writing is also decent. Also if you like to have to do quite a few Choices then this VN is pretty nice as it isnt super easy to get all the Endings. The Art is pretty different and unique, but not bad at all. 

Overall the Game is enjoyable and I do recommend it, however it is too expensive for only around 3 hours playtime and the Game really is missing H-Content. At least in my opinion the Game could be a lot better with some nice tasteful H-Scenes and a little bit of a longer Afterstory for all the Girls.

I will still rate it a 7/10 overall, as it is decent and wont be boring or anything.
For sure only buy it if you get it for a cheaper price though.

Check out my Currator Page: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34401214/ for more Reviews :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996720254', 'num_games_owned': 2069, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1560640824}
review:
No, seriously, how does someone's parents fuck up THAT badly?!

PROS: Where the story is something that's been told multiple times before, they try not to go the traditional routes with this type of idea.  They do take some time to focus on the characters, and it is welcome, as it fleshes them out a fair bit to give them some personality.  The art style definitely won't be for everyone, but it is something different.

CONS: The game moves at a bit too fast of a pace, diving through the entire semester a little quickly.  There isn't any voice acting as well.  And even though the character's name and portrait comes up, the only way to tell the difference between internal thoughts and speech is to make sure the text isn't in italics.  The soundtrack is rather hit or miss, some charming stuff, but mostly forgettable.

ACHIEVEMENTS: A quick 4 that are gotten by going for the good endings.  You'll get them all just playing for them with relative ease.

FINAL: For a relatively worn idea in VN's, I actually enjoyed playing through this, mainly due to the characters.  Though it was a nice take on it, and I would recommend at least one playthrough if one is looking for a simple VN, I still don't see myself dropping back in for another playthrough.  So take this recommendation with a grain of salt in that regard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095882363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1583852593}
review:
It is short, very short, really short and you should 
decide if you love your money or you love short stories more then your money.

And the nudity tag? WTF did tag it, there is no nudity, not even with a lot of fantasy
- thats a big problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321567799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1598991884}
review:
My god this game is boring.

I'm sorry but I'd have it easier if this game was a comic; it has the same level of interactivity, you just hit space for most of what I played until sometimes an option will pop up that would progress a dialog tree. Like seriously, there's no porn, there's no voices, there's no minigames I got to see nothing that "erotic" this is softcore erotism, not even softcore pron.

At least some visual novels have a few answers when a character engages yours, here I was just like "will it ask me what I th- oh it won't the character will just do as it's said". That was so boring.

It'd be worth it if the busty girls at least got topless, or if those boobs were animated, that'd make me stick around. But no, the plot was just "local kid goes trap gets fined for SWL (straight while lesbian)".

author: {'steamid': '76561198303993330', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1545694775}
review:
Highschool Romance is one of those games that starts out with a solid comedic plot, but slowly falls downhill over all the glaringly obvious poor points. It's not a bad game overall, but there are so many small issues that didn't sit right with me and I can't suggest anyone try this game who actually wants something of decent value.

The plot itself sounds like a cheesy anime story, and does fairly well on that front. Due to an enrollment mistake by his busy parents, Shoji accidentally gets enrolled in an all-girls school and is forced to keep his identity a secret in order to finish his final year of high school. While not a bad plot, even if a slightly cliched one, the biggest issue here is that it doesn't really matter. When I say this, I mean that in the different endings the different characters (minor spoiler)[spoiler]make it clear they knew all along and just don't care[/spoiler]. To me, even for a cheesy comedy, that's beyond unrealistic, and decreases the story value immediately.

When it comes down to it, Highschool Romance is not a $13 visual novel, so if you do have a curiousity to sate with this game at least get it on a very good sale. The run time comes to a couple hours, with the choices barely changing the plot up until the endings. Events still happen much the same way, no matter who you pick. There's an illusion of choice through a linear story, with branching paths only splitting off at the ends. I've read free visual novels who have multiple different endings with uniquely varied content, as well as doing more with similar run times.

By far the biggest sore point is one of the routes themselves, that of the high school student and the principal. Sure, you can swing it that someone in their last year of high school is probably 18, but the route itself comes off as cringy at best. While the other routes have some sort of "equal" interaction between the main character and the interests mutually getting to know each other, the principal route comes off as predatory [spoiler]as they're seen in dressing rooms together without Shoji's prior knowledge and agreement, and the principal taking Shoji over to her house during break[/spoiler]. It stood out to me by far as the worst route of the game, and soured my view of the rest of the story.

I'll admit I liked the more rounded and cozy art style, fresh as it was to see a visual novel not distinctly "anime" in looks. However, it all feels very bland with the characters looking much of the same, except for minor changes like outfits, hair and eyes. The backgrounds felt very flat in tone and blended together in a weird sort of way, almost as if there were no light and shadow. It's visually nice to look at, but there's room for some improvements in the future.

When it comes to games like this, sometimes too much is just too much. A few low points don't make or break a game until they stack on so heavily it's hard to look past. If you can see past the poor choice in the way the story was told, maybe there's something here for you to enjoy. It's not something I can see myself recommending, just for the way the content was handled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158196956', 'num_games_owned': 3737, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1535429800}
review:
Shoji is a top student, his grades are fantastic, but unfortunately his life is unstable with his parents always traveling. He never had enough time to create real friendships, but this year, it‚Äôs the very final year of high school, and as always, Shoji is sent to a school while his parents are away. Nothing out of the ordinary, except‚Ä¶ The school his mother sent him, is a girl-only institution. One of the best nonetheless, but still, an issue considering Shoji is a perfectly normal and healthy young man.

Lea, the school‚Äôs principal, comes up with the idea of maintaining Shoji in the school, by making him pass as a girl throughout the year. Won‚Äôt be easy, but with a few tips, a new hairstyle and some light makeup, Shoji can pass as a girl, and the plan is in motion. Can Shoji make friends even though he is secretly a boy? Or will his shy personality stop him from getting close to any of the girls in his class?

[b]Highschool Romance[/b] is the fourth game developed and published by [i]Dharker Studio[/i], with an interesting plot that we rarely get to see in a Visual Novel. Most fans either expect this to be a romantic comedy, or a dating game tagged with Trap, Crossdressing or even Futanari all over it, but worry not, as this is a simple and funny romantic comedy.

Plot moves around Shoji trying to deal with his new temporary identity, clothing and behavior near other female students. Players interact with three different girls, as possible dates. Lea is one of them, a somehow older woman who fantasises with Shoji in several cosplay items.¬†Students Selina and Hoshi, are also romantic dates, each very different from the other. Selina is a popular athlete, while Hoshi is a bookworm at heart, and both represent different paths for Shoji to romantically get involved through friendship and trust. There are several events where one must choose who to be with, lunch, school activities and special weekends with that special girl are some of the choices that will result in the inevitable ending.

As gameplay goes, players can expect a traditional Visual Novel with key decisions that determine the ending routes, along this three hour adventure. With humour and light emotions attached to characters, [b]Highschool Romance[/b] does not have an adult patch, and it‚Äôs not sexualized entirely, however, it‚Äôs extremely erotic when comes to flirting and fantasies such as Cosplay, in which are heavily present.

Technically the game is presented with great quality, even if upscaled to 1920x1080 or higher. Renders don‚Äôt lose significant quality, and as usual for [i]Dharker Studio[/i] games, the visual quality holds up. [b]Highschool Romance[/b] it‚Äôs only available in English and contrary to the game prior to this one, we don‚Äôt get to have voice-acting, but the dialogues and literacy remain as good as ever.

Each character has its own personality, and its deep rooted in their behavior towards our protagonist. Some, such as Lea or Selina, are more flirty and it is reflected in the choices players can adopt. In some specific moments, scenes end periodically to soon, and advance towards another very different scene, pushing forward particular moments too soon.¬†This only happens a handful of times, and even if doesn‚Äôt leave lacunas in the storyline, it‚Äôs still rare to see this behavior in previous Visual Novels by the studio. Nonetheless the game is well directed and is presented with a distinct order of events, never compromising the experience or plot. Dialogues are extremely smart, engaging and captivating, which is rare to see!

[b]Highschool Romance[/b] follows an optimistic and positive artwork, with pleasant backgrounds that although are simplistic and basic, set well within the game‚Äôs plot and momentum. Every situation, location and event have its own space, maintaining the artwork atmosphere intact.¬†Characters are designed as it‚Äôs already common among [i]Dharker Studios[/i] releases, through a more western style. Every character style has a very distinct look, and although they have some emphasized body shapes, they still have a very cartoonish outlook, that somehow fit perfectly with the humoristic characteristics of the game.

Cutscenes are displayed with special drawing pictures representing a special key moment in the game. They improve in the details, but at the same time preserving their style, which is the most important thing. Overall appeals are nice, such as the menus and text colors, especially because each different character has a unique text color, making it fun to read.

As soundtrack goes, [b]Highschool Romance[/b] is one of the weakest releases by [i]Dharker Studios[/i]. The soundtrack is not available for purchase, but in-game music tracks are simple and serve the only purpose of creating the necessary ambience, to avoid the uncomfortable background silence of not having a soundtrack at all. Compared to other games such as [b]Beach Bounce[/b] or [b]Divine Slice of Life[/b], the soundtrack in this title is uninspiring. The handful of tracks seems to keep on a loop depending on the scenes, ranging from neo-classic tunes in a modern approach, with still the typical upbeat and nice atmosphere regardless.

In a less sexualized context, and with no nudity, [b]Highschool Romance[/b] still manages to become sexy and interesting for those looking for a naughty escapade. Yet, it‚Äôs the romantic element that brings this game to the spotlight, with its comicality events, and the overall mess that our protagonist got himself into. A fantastic game with a very unique storyline and artwork that will definitely please anyone looking for a casual and funny Visual Novel.

review: This game competely changed my view on visual novels. The story had a good balance of important and trivial decisions, which allowed for some wiggle-room with certain routes, and the decisions never seemed unreasonable or unatrual. I enjoyed the story so much that, even after unlocking every route and obtaining every photo, I also wanted to make every interaction and test the limits of getting certain endings. The visuals were soft and had great attention to detail, which only added to my enjoyment. Even after doing everything I could think of, I still enjoy occassionally coming back to it and playing though the story because I enjoy it so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068724052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1529928964}
review:
It's incredibly bland, boring, and unoriginal.  Like, they just took every stereotype for the "boy stuck with a bunch of girls" scenario and just pasted them together.  They couldn't even be bothered to switch things up a bit or add their own flair to things.  It's all cookie-cutter, checkbox, story-telling.

If you're really into effeminate boys trying to be girls, then you'll probably be fine.  However, play "My Life as a Maiden" before you play this one.  That one is at least willing to throw in some actual originality to the story.  Plus, I like the art style more.

review:
Mmm............... I'm trying not to view it in an entirely negative light, but it should be noted that it's a little transphobic and  bigoted in its own way. I'm sure it's not meant to be, but some of the material is offensive. [spoiler]Especially when Selina found out and said she thought Shoji identified as a girl, yet still called him a boy even afterwards, and said that's what he really was. If she thought Shoji identified as a girl, then she shouldn't have called him a boy. Simple as that.[/spoiler]

But really, I'm trying to ignore that and play it as it's meant to be. The art is cute, if a little exaggerated; but god, the girls..... I am a Lesbian(tm) so I liked that lmao.

Idk, I'm neutral, but I'm gonna hit recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108627512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1597630308}
review:
Well, that was interesting. 
The story was told through the eyes of a guy in an all girls school who has no past experience with being personal with one. So the writing played up the stereotypes for some of the jokes and while it could be seen as a little tasteless it shows character's background of inexperience. It shouldn't be a deal breaker as the stereotypes appear and dissapear pretty quickly and aren't played up to much. The three love interests are written in a way that makes sense and has heavy characteristics showing through that are pretty common for a high school style thing. Selina the athletic type, Hoshi the study, and Lea the motherly type. Again the stereotypes aren't played up to the point of annoyance just to the point to where you don't forget you are in a high school. Before I get to the art style, I have to say that Selina had a progressive moment with the main character and I enjoyed the inclusion of it. The art is nice all the way through and I never got tired of it. Eventually I found the button that hides the text and I got to see one of the characters (Lea I belive) whole and I laughed a little bit. I checked the other two characters and I found that it wasn't a simple character trait but an epidemic. All the energy that goes into growing normal legs went into their boobs leaving their knees abnormally small. In all seriousness though, the art is great and the sexualization of the characters isn't too distracting, 
Conclussions, both the story and art is good so I can recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047696463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1520335464}
review:
It is obvious that a lot of heart and soul went into this game. And the artwork is lovely, wonky horse legs and watermelons masquerading as breasts aside.

But, for me, the writing was not up to scratch for the pricepoint. The characters are ...unpleasant, I suppose is the best word. They say, and do, some honestly pretty offensive stuff and I don't mean in a fun way, more in a genuinely bigoted way. Which, when the game is supposed to be fun and light, can be pretty jarring.

Normally I wouldn't review so seriously, but given that I bought this based off of the extremely positive reviews, I thought it worth while to offer a counterpoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137081930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1517119037}
review: Bless this game, despite the werid ass designs of the characters. Perspective is a huge point and I love it. It also helps that the main character is a feminine dude, cause I happen to be one as well. Anyway, yeah, uh, not as much as I thought I'd say. Being represented feels great, and observing what it's somewhat like to live as the opposite gender is interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111058910', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1515142669}
review:
Un juego bastante corto (2 horas) pero con un excelente cuidado en la musica y arte.

No contiene Sexo ni escenas explicitas.

Es un juego que explora el tema de ser el unico chico en una escula de chicas y ademas disfrazado como una, bajo la complicidad de la directora

La jugabilidad deja mucho que desear y bien podrian haber dejado mas finales y CG  o hacer que las reacciones fuera de las escenas fueran mas variadas.

Es un juego que comprarias si esta de oferta y quieres apoyar al artista o por alguna promocion del fabricante.

Aapesar de ser entretenido deja con la sensacion que le falto algo mas y desaprovecha todas las situacines de ser el unico hombre en la escula de chicas.

LO recomiendo solo por que quiero ver mas titulos con este estilo de arte

review: Dharker games goes pre-teen. G rated family fun. The trouble is that the non-sexual vn's have some very good writing and memorable situations so the competition is tough--- and I would compare this to a rerun of the old Dick Van Dyke show. Amusing --sweet--and utterly forgotten within minutes of finishing. Ebi-Hime has some non-sexual vn's that set the bar pretty high or Catch Canvas without the patch. I am trying to think of something positive to say about High School Romance but as I did not care for the art or the story --I really can't.

review:
Una novela entretenida, cada ruta tiene lo suyo (en lo personal mi favorita es la ruta de Lea).
No recomendar√≠a comprarlo a precio completo, es algo corta para lo que cuesta, espera a que tenga un buen descuento para comprarla.
Su corta duraci√≥n hace que pareciera que de la noche a la ma√±ana ya le gustas a una de las chicas. Es el √∫nico punto que puedo considerar negativo, no desarrollan demasiado la relaci√≥n de Shoji con ellas y es extra√±o ver en qu√© momento les tiene tanta confianza al final.
Entre los puntos positivos est√° el apartado visual que es muy atractivo y contiene situaciones interesantes con cada personaje.

A pesar de sus fallos la recomiendo (en descuento) para pasar el rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066248283', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1509548910}
review:
Pretty solid game, had some moments here and there that really questioned what I should do, and it didn't feel like just a choice, it was like I actually felt bad if I didn't get the right one, first sign of a good VN.

Second, the artstyle is the main reason I picked this up, it's rather unique as the characters are still anime-esque, but also have a cartoon aspect to them, almost as though they are American cartoons with anime features. So that's a plus.

Good choices all around, great character development as well.

Rather quick game depending on which route you take, I'd give it 2.5 or 3 hours just to be safe.

review:
¬øPor donde empezar? 
La premisa de un chico vestido de chica yendo a una escuela exclusiva para chicas est√° muy mal aprovechada. En momentos incluso parece que el hecho de que seas un chico no importa. El juego es muy corto, y en el poco tiempo que dispone no logra hacer que te intereces por una chica m√°s alla de su apariencia. Adem√°s, el poco contenido que el juego ofrece realmente hace dudar si vali√≥ la pena el precio completo, si lo compraste en oferta entonces muy bien por ti, las expresiones fasciales y las poses en los personajes son realmente nulas, al menos tienen algunos cambios de ropa, pero se siente antinatural tener una conversaci√≥n triste con alguien que tiene una sonrisa en el rostro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198246234164', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1505705665}
review:
Overview:

Highschool (sic) Romance is a visual novel set at a private school.  The main character is a boy sent to the school by his parents, only to find out the admission policy changed, and that the school is now an all-female institution of learning.  For reasons unknown, the principal of the school decides to admit the main character, but transvestize him to fit in for whatever reason.  Along the way, the main character encounters two other girls in addition to the principal.  Expecting more people to be encountered?  I know I was.

Graphics and sound:

Highschool Romance cuts so many corners, the programmers would be better suited for making globes.  The main thing that really stood out to me, was that gym class was being held outdoors, and yet the graphic on screen was the stock picture of the gymnasium:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1137937624

I should have taken a closer look at the graphics when I got Highschool Romance, but for some odd reason, it wasn't until I got in game, that I noticed that every female in the game looks like they have a Hapsburg jaw.  In fact, the jaws are even more pronounced on the females than the male character, which may explain why the principal thought the main character could pass for female.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1137933234

I was also disappointed by a scene in which another character attempts to put makeup on the main character, yet all you're treated to, is the same stock picture of the main character and his Plain Jane face.  Not even the tiny picture of the main character features him wearing makeup, yet you would think that such a scene was big enough to warrant a full sized screenshot.

The sound is nothing special.  The music isn't my style, but it's a letdown in the sense that it doesn't help set the mood of the game, which should be the be all, end all for a game's soundtrack.  There's very little sound effects to speak of, and none that stand out.

Positives:

Although the idea of transvestized (and sex changed) anime boys is nothing new, I did have a lot of fun with the concept of this game earlier on.  I was really humored in the beginning when the principal takes the main character shopping for girl's clothes.  It's obvious that shopping trip was designed by a man, because there was a lengthy trip for lingerie shopping.  (My personal favorite part of the game.)  But absolutely no mention was made of buying shoes.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1137933725

Negatives:

The main character is in a school full of girls, and yet only three other people seem to exist.  The only interesting thing about the trio, is that they have Hapsburg jaws.  They're merely just stock characters masquerading as major characters with no interesting details or personality quirks about them.  The athletic girl in the game has the same physical attributes as every other athletic girl in Anime (including warrior women):  Her arms and legs are just as lacking in muscle as every other female in the game (or movie), and her breasts have the same amount of fat as every other non-athletic girl.

I'll admit to being suckered into those tags on Steam that infer Highschool Romance has nudity and mature content.  Both of these were lacking.  I was thinking that maybe I should play through the game again and see if there's any other path that offers nude scenes, but I lost interest in the game soon afterwards.  Just as well, because I noticed that all of the "interesting" pictures from the game are online outside of Steam, anyway, and I saw none that contained nudity.

Adult content aside, when a game has the word "Romance" in the title, I don't expect anything less.  The kissing I saw in the one path I took was just that; kissing without substance.  I felt no sort of attachment to the girl that the main character was kissing, and I'm sure the rest of the girls would have been equally disappointing.  No dialogue to infer how much in love both characters were with one another, zero passion in the pictures involving "love," and really, absolutely no sense of beauty in intimacy.

Conclusion:

The game would have been more aptly labeled "High School Transvestism," since it's an even bigger point of the game than the romance.  But I've learned my lesson:  Don't pay more than a dollar for a game that has only four achievements!

review: I wouldn't recommend this game to most people due to the story just being so...bland. It's a very short game with no real payoff for the hero of this story other than the joke that dies too soon of him having to dress and pretend he's a woman, [spoiler] which is utterly useless because it turns out that the female counterparts in the whole story knew he was a guy almost from the start of the story![/spoiler] All in all, if you're looking for something short with a comedic twist, I would say this is a good choice. If you were like me, looking for a deeper story with real consequences to decisions and well-written dialogue, I'd go check out most anything else on Steam like Everlasting Summer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004313984', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1497029907}
review:
Highschool Romance is a slice-of-life visual novel developed and published by Dharker Studio. After moving to a new city, it's the start of Shoji's final year of high school but because of a crazy mix-up by his parents, he is due to attend an all girls school. Backing out now would be a costly process that would delay him from graduating on time with his class, fortunately, the principal has a solution to this strange crisis...pretend to be a girl in order to attend. You soon discover that what would have been a "dream-come-true" to many a male student is actually a lot more complicated. In this unusual situation, can you survive, make friends, or even find love? Highschool Romance is a light hearted V.N. full of teen angst and hilarious situations.

Graphically, this visual novel is a wonderful delight to the eyes and has a top notch presentation just as all of Dharker Studios V.N.'s do. It has a manga-inspired artstyle that is extremely gorgeous and filled with bright colors as well as beautiful effects. Also of note is the fantastic audio quality and a quite memorable soundtrack which is delightful and fits the story perfectly. In summary, the excellent visuals and terrific aurals do a great job of complimenting the outrageous yet intriguing plot of Highschool Romance.

This novel was a great read with endearing art and a very well written if not whimsical story. There are many decisions to make and multiple endings so the replayability is fairly high. Also, this V.N. offers a few options such as an image gallery to unlock as the narrative progresses, there are also Steam Achievements and Steam Trading cards to collect. In the end, Highschool Romance is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED to fans of the visual novel genre and anyone in general who likes "fish out of water" stories.

review: This game is loads of fun althought I'd be more inclined to call it a interactive story. Here's what I liked about it frist it's a comedy that is funny with out the need to be stuiped or volger. Secondly the art work is JRPG greatness it looks simluer to animies like Sword Art Online and Yu-Gi-Ho! this is sadly were it ends though. (yes my spelling sux) So here's the down side of it. Frist no voice acting (witch it needs badly) realy anyone of the street could do it. Secondly the soundtrack is awful it best for background noise is all. Last of all too short of a game there's no classroom interaction you don't realy do anything say read the words. My answer to this is Bully yes it's not the same setting (get over yourself) but it also has a kid in school a few mods and you'd have a far better version of Highschool Romance. If this game is $10 or less (steam sale it) then get it otherwise don't bother.

review:
Highschool Romance is not a great game, it's extremely short, there are several spelling errors and a couple continuity errors, and the plot is _very_ stock
But, that said, it's still a fun game. The art style is very cute and the characters are endearing. It's like video game cotton candy, sweet and fluffy but there's very little actually there. 
I can't say it's worth the full 12.99, but if it's on sale for 50% or more off, then i'd say it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048817935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1499246135}
review:
[h1][i]Il Lupo Cattivo √® un crossdresser.[/i][/h1]

Highschool Romance √® una Visual Novel incentrata sul crossdressing, tema piuttosto raro. Il nostro protagonista, Shoji, infatti viene trasferito in una nuova scuola... peccato che sia solo per ragazze. Consigliato dalla preside e facendo di necessit√† virt√π, decide di travestirsi da ragazza potendo cos√¨ frequentare la scuola per non perdere troppo tempo e rischiare di restare indietro con l'istruzione. 

La storia si focalizza poi sulla vita quotidiana dello studente- pardon, della studentessa e delle sue amiche, Selina e Hoshi, cercando di non far trapelare nulla sulla sua reale identit√†.

E purtroppo questo era l'unico aspetto positivo del gioco, ovvero il tema del crossdressing, un tema raramente usato. Ma per il resto, la storia si presenta molto leggera e spensierata, si finisce tranquillamente nel giro di un'ora/un'ora e mezza e presenta 3 finali differenti.

Inoltre ho trovato lo stile grafico un po'... meh. Non l'ho apprezzato molto, forse perch√© sono troppo abituato allo stile giapponese delle visual novel mentre questo qua mi sembra un pasticcio tra lo stile occidentale e giapponese.

Ora magari direte "eh ma c'√® il contenuto erotico!". 

No. Steam adotta una politica un po' severa sui contenuti sessuali e anche se i dev e i modders aggirano ci√≤ grazie all'utilizzo di patch e mods, questo gioco non presenta nessuna patch 18+. Per cui la componente erotica √®...minima. Le ragazze (si, incluso anche il nostro caro travestito) potremo ammirarle solo in biancheria intima al massimo. Tuttavia considerando che non ho apprezzato lo stile grafico...

In conclusione, mi ha deluso. L'ho preso in un bundle, ma personalmente, considerato il prezzo, anche in saldo, non lo comprerei singolarmente.

Voto: 4.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198039504147', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1679778377}
review:
Absolument pas fan de light Novel, j'ai obtenu Highschool Romance et Magi Trial (un spin off) dans un bundle et je doit dire que c'est une bonne surprice.

L'histoire est assez plaisante √† suivre et on vois pas le temps passez (4H environs), le chara-design est vraiment cool.

Cependant quelque probl√®me
- Beaucoup de choix que sont seulement √™tre l√† pour √™tre l√† et qui n'ont aucun impact
- Seulement 3 voie (donc 3 filles) et aucun perso secondaire
- Seulement en anglais (ce qui est propre a pratiquement tout les Light Novel et c'est assez chiant je trouve)

Donc pour le moment c'est un oui et h√¢te de voir Magi Trial

author: {'steamid': '76561197995727085', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1498620196}
review:
The art is great! The music is all right. The character design is pretty good. But I can't in good conscience give this game a thumbs up because of the sheer lack of content. I installed, played, and completed this game in one afternoon. Less than four hours of reading is not nearly enough, and I saw literally every scene. The people who made this game obviously did so with love and creativity, and I liked what there was, but there simply wasn't enough. It was basically a one-act story, without any of the time necessary to produce a build-up of tension. Not enough time for real conflict to emerge and resolve.

There are other details I'm concerned with, like how shoehorned the drinking scene was, but I think a lot of these problems were caused because the writers wanted to cram in a variety of scenes but the game was too small to fit them. I'm interested in the future work of all the creators involved, because I don't think this game showcased their talents properly.

Disappointing. I was expecting more. How is this considered romance when there is hardly any buildup? Also its marked as mature with nudity... but all there is, is girls in their underwear. I really liked the art style and the idea of this visual novel. But I just feel that it needed more put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065440424', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1495959811}
review:
(NOT SPOILER FREE)

For this prize, we should get much longer story, much more choices and... Just more everything. It's scam, totally not worth time and money. You don't believe me? Let me get you this:

‚òë You play as a boy who pretends to be a boy because "he has no choice" (there is explenation in story, but for me it makes no sens and is just... so dumb)
‚òë Through the entire game you are able to talk ONLY to 3 girls (which one of them is only avaiable via picking very specific options) but technically it's JUST 2
‚òë These woman are crazy over you, they act like they alredy know that you have the one and only penis at the campus couse they are so... Sticky. I mean like they want your attencion, spend with you a lot of time and so on. This is unnatural. Well, it seems like it in this game (not because I know MCH is boy)
‚òë AND one of them is even SCHOOL PRINCIPAL (Lea, the sercret avaiable one) with whom you can END UP GETTING MARRIED
‚òë Not a lot of arts as for game that swivel mostly around 3 (with main character) people

Looking at the fact that I ended the game (and clicker throught it next 2 times to get all achi) speaks for itselfs - it may be not that bad. Story is some how interested in some points, but overall is not that great. Not boring to death but seems lazy and simple, too simple and too limited to have such high cost.

review:
I really enjoyed the gb theme and love the character design (artstyle) of the game. The characters are very likeable and the whole experience is cheerful with various fun encounters. I really had fun playing the game. On the downside it's rather short and doesn't offer many choices. The music is rather forgettable and gets repetitive after a while. There are quite a few scenes where a dedicated character animation/portrait or background fitting the events would've been great... Reading about a special scene with stuff happening with a boring standard background you've seen 10 times before is rather unsatisfying.

If you like the theme you will enjoy this game for a discount price (-50% or more)

review:
I'm a sucker for these kinds of scenarios, and this VN is a comedy at heart. You have three girls to choose from, one of which is your principal.  Whom I find rather "[i] endowed [/i] and the two other girls are too. Also, the art style is very original and the script is pretty good.  However, it's too short. I completed each route less than three hours, even got all the achievements. Sadly, all the choices seem repetitive after awhile. 

However, this game is wonderful and puts a hilarious spin on the gender bender story.


[spoiler] I wonder why in the story no one questioned the bulge in the shorts or when Shoji is changing. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198319223099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1561822773}
review:
After playing Highschool Possession, I was expecting this to be a nice play but nothing too exciting to get invested in. I'm delighted to say that Highscool Romance turned out to be one of those visual novels that I wish would've been longer.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Nice idea
+ Entire cast is likeable
+ Going back on text is easy in case you missed something
+ Automode works seamlessly 

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Pacing is awkward
- Could've used more CG
- No H-scenes for those who absolutely need them
- MC's thoughts are italicized but it can still be hard to tell when he's thinking and when speaking 

[b]Final verdict:[/b] ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ 
6/10 - Above Average 
The art style of the game isn't pleasing to me personally but I suppose it isn't entirely unsightly. The backgrounds are decent even if occasionally it's obvious they didn't pay that much attention to what they were using with dialogue (for example, main character talks about being exercising outside while they are clearly inside the gym). Music is simple and repetitive, but not distracting. The game is short and relatively easy to 100% if you care about that, and the plot isn't complicated while managing to stay interesting. 

First of all, this game doesn't come with any restoration patches because the game itself doesn't have any H-content. If this is what you are looking for in your visual novel then you can skip this title, the most you are going to get is few shots of undergarments and even then the situations never go anywhere lewd. This can be disappointing since the game would offer some nice fetish fodder if it was willing to go there, but I digress. 

For those who'd want to pick this up because of girl-on-girl romance, that's not something that is present. As the description for the game states, this visual novel is about a male protagonist in an all-girls school. He is forced to crossdress and even if you are one who'd think you could play it while imagining that he's a girl, that's unlikely as the main character keeps reminding the player about his gender through the entire VN. If you want girl love, then you can't find (or pretend to find) it here.

As stated, the plot revolves around Shoji, a boy who is mistakenly admitted into an all-girls school and at the encouragement of the principal he agrees to dress up as a girl in order to be able to stay at the school. As a protagonist Shoji is a decent and unsure person, his main worry is being found out and he never comes across as a creep. The story revolves around Shoji's relationship with two girls his age, as well as the principal if you make the right choices that will include her in the story line. His relationship with the two main girls, Selina and Hoshi, is based on friendship for the majority of the game and his romantic interest seems to rise only when the girls themselves bring it to the table.

There is definitely a pacing issue in this game and the end of the game comes really suddenly, making it feel like the devs rushed it or simply gave up on the project. This comes from the fact that majority of the beginning was spent building Shoji's friendship with the girls, and once the romantic advances were introduced the game just takes a beeline to the epilogue, which can make the entire experience unsatisfactory. Before getting to a couple words on each girl's route, I wanted to make a note that you can get bad endings in this. In my first playthrough I ended up getting turned down when I thought I was keeping a friendly relationship to Hoshi while obviously going for Selina. 

Now couple words about the girls themselves, in the order that I cleared them.
[b]Selina[/b] ‚Äì Admittedly I knew I was going for her immediately, just based on her looks. Her personality can either be endearing or downright irritating, and even though I generally liked her, the bad ending with her did make me resent her just a tiny bit. She's definitely an interesting character, and her banter with Shoji is fun. 
[b]Hoshi[/b] ‚Äì  She was definitely less consistent in personality than Selina was, but I have to say I was surprised that I found her to be sweet toward the end. However she never stroke me personally as anything other than the best friend type, so I didn't like having Shoji end up with her but that's probably because I'm not partial to meganekko types.
[b]Lea[/b] ‚Äì I wasn't going to do her route at all because I don't see the appeal in the set up, but I decided to do it for the sake of this review. She was definitely the trickiest ending to get, and I just didn't see it as worth it. 

Now, all three girls were nice but nothing groundbreaking so why did I enjoy this game as much as I did? In addition to the protagonist, I liked that the girls were friendly with each other even when competing. There was very minimal drama involved in this game, which I found to be refreshing. This was also one of the very rare occasions when I wish there had been an option for harem ending, because I enjoyed the chemistry Selina and Hoshi had with each other, so I would've welcomed the chance to have them be together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1488684410}
review:
This visual novel is a comedy, centered around a small error in application to an all-girls school. Shoji, the protagonist was sent to this boarding school because his mother had gone there, back when it was a coed school. Why she also marked the female box is a bit more of a mystery. Still, not being able to find another school quickly, and with his parents in government work (seriously, they never show up during the entire school year), the principal comes up with a solution. One that is a bit... odd. Shoji will pretend to be a girl.

Suitable high-jinks ensue including outfitting him with girl's clothes (especially undergarments). There are three potential love interests: Selina, the jock who shows him around the campus, Hoshi, his class representitive, and Leia... the school principal/gym teacher. Through a series of comedic events and miscues, you figure out who you wish to date, and if you choose correctly end up with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053905539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1507581547}
review:
I honestly enjoyed the absolute heck out of this game and I will easily recommend this to anyone willing to try a visual novel that takes a different perspective. Playing as a dude that isn't super hardcore masculine is nice for a change, and the whole cross-dressing thing is an added bonus. There are a few gramatical errors here and there but I still think this game is worth the pricetag put on it.

A solid 8/10 for making me as gay as I am today tho

author: {'steamid': '76561198045285633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1480919225}
review:
Highschool Romance is a game I really enjoyed, even though it was pretty short. I was kind of put off by the sexual tone and clich√© premise, since I was afraid it'd be a game with no plot or anything besides huge boobs. That's not too interesting to me. That said, you're of course free to buy the game purely for sexy waifus if you want. But I enjoyed it mostly because of the characters and dialogue. The 3 girls are interesting, and the writing is pretty self-aware and funny. Then there's also the lovely art style.

If you were looking for a game with GxG pairings (like I was), then you're outta luck. But the protagonist's gender identity is examined and there are some (respectful) lgbt+ mentions and aspects. I can't say much without spoiling anything, but an example would be the girls' sexualities. There's no "I'd be really into you if you were a boy..." or "I think I have feelings for you... b-but we're both girls!" None of that. These girls don't play around. So even if this wasn't what you were searching for, it's worth checking out if you like funny and lighthearted vn's ‚Äì especially if it's on sale.


Pros:

- Charming characters

- Good comedic execution

- Lovable art style


Cons:

- Only one ending for each character

- Short, 3.5 hours max to get all endings

- Clich√© premise

author: {'steamid': '76561198108191284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1485183197}
review:
Awkward but strangely memorable. For a visual novel, the price point is the largest negative. For a few hours of gameplay to complete all the endings; only hardcore fans will find this worth the price. The artwork is nice and the UI is easy to understand. Only complaint would be that it feels basic.

The ost is enjoyable and the story is decent. A highlight would be the branching paths that change the story in some way‚Äîwhich affects more dialogue than you would first expect. There are even a few ways to actually fail the game, not that it is very likely you will. But it adds some depth and encourages multiple playthroughs. 

If you're a big fan of visual novels you'll find enjoyment here. It's well made and there isn't much to fault besides it being a tad cliche. It's not particularly special but its far from bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053788131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1485617577}
review:
[h1]OVERVIEW[/h1]
Highschool Romance is another high-school-themed anime visual novel from Dharker Studio. 

You play Shoji, an 'effete-looking' boy who is incorrectly sent by his always-travelling parents to a prestigious boarding school, which happens to be girls only. After discovering the error Lea Rowen, the young principal of the school, suggests that you will be able to attend the school only under one condition: that you pretend to be a girl. The game covers Shoji's year at school, and the goal, you'll not be surprised to learn if you've played any similar games, is to succeed with one of the game's three possible love interests.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The characters are nicely drawn and the artist has done a good job of making Shoji androgynous; it's easy to believe he could be accepted at a girls' school. The backgrounds, too, are well drawn, but there aren't very many of them.

Unfortunately Highschool Romance suffers from the same sort of 'ghost-school' feel as Club Life; there are only four characters drawn at all, and even though some of the prose mentions other students and teachers interacting with Shoji, the graphics don't show it at all.

There are no graphics options to speak of, but the game should run fine even on a laptop with integrated graphics.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
I can't recall hearing any sound effects. The music is typical of the genre: fairly repetitive and unassuming.

There are also no voices, which seems to be a trait common to many (all?) of Dharker Studio's games. It's unfortunate; even though I don't understand spoken Japanese well, the spoken words in some other developers' visual novels do serve to enhance the experience significantly.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Highschool Romance plays like any other anime visual novel. You read the story, look at the scenes, and choose between one of two or three choices at set points in the story. Some choices are unimportant, but provide different flavour text for the story, while others determine which of the game's endings you will see. Will you end up with one of the game's love interests, or by yourself?

The game features three characters other than Shoji: Lea, the very young school principal who wears clothes that look remarkably like a school uniform; Hoshi, the nerdy, but lovable, class representative; and Selina, the enthusiastic blonde with a strong tendency to be flirty. The goal of the game is to survive without the general school population discovering your secret identity, and perhaps create a life-long relationship with one of these three women. Unlike many other games in the genre, both from Dharker Studio and others, Highschool Romance doesn't include any explicit adult content (hentai), and there's no patch available to enable it.

The writing in Highschool Romance is generally very good quality, although there are a few grammar errors and typos here and there.

[h1]PROS AND CONS[/h1]
Pros:
+ Interesting, if unbelievable, setting
+ Nice character art
+ Likeable characters
+ Steam achievements and trading cards

Cons:
- Deserted, 'ghost-school' feel again
- No voices
- Fairly short, even with multiple endings

[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]
Highschool Romance is a fun, short visual novel that doesn't resort to a gratuitous hentai gallery to draw in players. It has a nice story and likeable love interests, but could do with a bit more life in terms of background characters.

[h1]6/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970502966', 'num_games_owned': 1172, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1484378979}
review:
As I've seen others say for various games, I kinda wished Steam had an "Ehhhhh" or "Meh" option alongside the thumbs up or down, as some games just fall into such a position.  However, I think there's enough negatives to Highschool Romance that I will unfortunately have to lean towards not recommending the game.

The positives I'll state outright: it has an interesting concept, good music, and art that is different in an odd way but still more than competent.  The characters are also nicely done... somewhat.

That leads into the negatives, and unfortunately they started to pile up the more I played the game.

The first and most obvious problem is the minimal art, which seems strange that this would happen in a game where its more unique artstyle would be a possible pull.  This encompasses the backgrounds, special scene CG, and even character expressions - the last being probably the biggest problem.  A lot of times characters' expressions won't change even with the situation demanding it, which can result in some very awkward scenes.  Only the protagonist seems to have a good handful of different expressions to match the various situations.  Other characters have very minimal expression changes, usually none at all.

Not many backgrounds were done, and so you will have conversations that indicate moving to another place and yet the background would remain the same, again making the scene feel awkward.

With that, is special scene CG.  There is a really limited amount.  Three times more would've really liven up the game.  Instead, it's another way the game feels empty.  This along with only the four characters (including the protagonist) being the only people drawn, and the world feels very, very empty.

The writing is okay sometimes, but often if feels too forced.  Game just doesn't give itself room to breathe, as though it's rushing to the "meat" of the game.  Usually that's a good thing, but in a VN, it can easily work against it.  This feeling also comes across in conversations with characters.  While they got some good aspects to them, their manner of speech is most the time too blunt, and thus not allowing the characters to develop themselves.  They often feel unreal in how direct they are.

Other issues I have are things like time placement.  Scenes will jump from one to the next at times with little-to-no connection.  It can be difficult figuring out if an hour, a day, a week, or even months have passed by in-game time.

Along with that is the story feeling overall railroaded.  The branches only effect who you end up with (if anyone at all), and have no consequence to any other aspects of the story.  You'll still end up making friends with a character who you earlier chose to not even interact with, you'll still join a club when you directly avoid the activity for it, and you'll still have a romantic encounter with a specific character no matter what.

The last complaint I can think of almost sounds like a bug, and it may very well be one.  In one instance, a character wears risque nightwear, and your character has no special reaction.  Later, she wears the same nightwear, and your character reacts flustered.  Yet another time the game feels off.

There's good stuff forming as a basis for this game, but it feels like the work was rushed.  What is there has decent polish, but it's just not nearly enough to recommend as a VN, even with the relatively low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007471259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1484411452}
review:
Sadly, I cannot recomment this VN, 3/10. 
First, I could not get used to the strange graphic... the girls look distorted, a mixture of a cow and swollen head... so not attractive at all... 
2nd, the stories are just too unimportant and irrelevant... I am really not sure who the target audience of this VN is, but it must be on the younger side (10-14 year girls?)
Lastly, in contrast to some other VN from the same company, there is no adult patch, which makes point 2 even stronger...

The only reason why I consider it "only" a waste of time, but not entirely bad, is because the quality of the text, and some of the music is decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176783243', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 488, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1469511183}
