author: {'steamid': '76561198092708539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1483148570}
review:
Highschool Romance is rich in visual attitude, but it fails to capitalize on a rousing plot point due to its shortcomings in character variety and meaningful choices. Its price tag and pleasing presentation do, however, offset its faults making it a short but cute experience. 


[b]The Good:[/b]

Highschool Romance offers a different perspective into the visual novel x school life genre: that of a boy dressed up as a girl. While it may remind some of a famous asian drama, the cotton candy of an art style used to design the four main characters keeps the premise somewhat fresh. I recall launching the game for the first time and seeing the pastel like UI take over my screen, leaving me to gawk at the fonts used to set the tone of the visual novel. Then I saw the character design which immediately elicited fond memories of some of my favorite artists growing up. The art direction is certainly the game's selling point, and is in full display in every key scene. 

The plot in Highschool Romance is simple. A desperate boy in need of graduating takes on an all girl school donning a shirt and skirt, because it's the only school that apparently accepted him. Beating this in one hour and getting one of the handful of possible endings is reasonable. I received my first ending just shy of one hour, but I am a fast reader. Choices are present so there is a risk of missing out on achievements which is a welcome element in visual novels. 

I found the sound quality to be decent for the most part with a few melodies proving exceptionally catchy: the menu screen for one. One of them even made me smirk as it sounded more like a tune fit for a timer warning in a nintendo platformer. 

[b]The Not So Sood:[/b]

The choices weren't always clear or did it hint of their their implications with respect to the few story paths available. While I did appreciate the myriad of choices presented, upon clearing the game, I was not sure whether some choices truly had an effect on the plot. I think some were included to merely pad the experience rather than provide a means of steering the protagonist to a potential ending. Furthermore, the characters even in their climactic moments seemed to still lack development, especially given the divergent nature of the choices which left some characters in the shadow.

I saw the potential in the story the moment the protagonist agreed to change his outfit, but then I realized that the characters advertised on Steam were going to be the only characters in the entire game. Not a single NPC or the generic I'm-here-to-guide-you friend are present to counter the flow. Simply put, not enough variety. The same goes for the songs. It could have used more variety, because no matter how soothing the tunes may have been, they wore me out by the midway point. 

Lastly, the still images shown by the Steam previews account for a significant portion of the total stills present in the whole game. That shocks me now that I look back at it, and it further exemplifies the need for more variety, especially in a visual novel with characters so well designed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047222893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1482934055}
review:
Bought it for the art style on a whim. It's okay I guess, but not really good enough to recommend. Let's break it down:

First Major Complaint: I literally bought it for the art style and the game seems to go out of it's way to not provide art. It is incredibly stingy with new art and most of the fun poses seen in the previews account for a decent amount of the special art shots you unlock. It doesn't even provide a picture of fireworks when such a thing would be appropriate. 

Pros:
* Decent art style when art is provided
* Cute characters
* Main character isn't insufferable
* Story has potential for decent humor

Cons:
* Literally only four characters including you. No one else appears to exist at the school
* Romance is very shallow
* No real landmark moments to make the game memorable. Pretty much just a meeting, a couple "fun" activities, a kiss, and a game over
* Talking about lack of time spent with characters, all of three romance options are extremely one-dimensional and typically only have a couple traits that define their entire character


It should be noted that I don't typically play Dating Sims (I've really only played a couple and the only two I can remember the name of is Katawa Shoujo and Magical Diary) so my expectations probably aren't in line with most since I didn't even realize this was a dating sim when I got it.

Side Question: Is there any reason this game is set in Japan beyond genre convention?

EDIT: Figured I may as well expand my review a bit.

First and foremost, I didn't dislike this game. I don't even think it's a bad game really. 10$ for around 3 hours of content is fine with me. However, I also don't think it's good enough to actually recommend.

Criticisms:

* The game doesn't really build your relationship up with any of the characters very well. The principal is probably the most fleshed out in this context, though there are quite a few unanswered questions with that path. You might think that you would get some time to learn about the characters and understand what they need in a relationship (which is something I have noticed occurs commonly in other romance titles that I have played). This doesn't happen. In fact, only one of the three characters do I know for a fact has a living family.

* The humor of the premise isn't used very well. To be frank I feel that it would pretty much be the same if you were just a non-straight girl in the academy. There are a lot of opportunities for misadventures that don't come to fruition.

* There isn't really a lot of actual choice in the game. Using a guide (to 100%) revealed to me that many of few choices that there are tend to be completely cosmetic and not really affect the story at all.

* The academy isn't fleshed out at all and you have no freedom to see it. While it might be interesting to meet some of the teachers and other girls going about, you don't really get to do any of that.


It has a lot of problems and is probably the worst game of its kind that I have personnally played. That doesn't mean it's terrible though and if you can get around the glaring flaws of the game go ahead and get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095435153', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482810762}
review:
OK I'm not really sure how I feel about this. I started it and beat it in 2-3 hours. However what looked like an obvious lock in wtih one girl, turned out to end with a bad ending. So i backtracked a bit to try with the other girl i had put more options into and still got a bad ending.
I'll likely replay the story again I really loved the idea of having to be a Crossdressing student but I wished there were mechanics or more choices. Your secret never really felt important after a bit...
I kind of wished this was more of a stat managment dating sim/visual novel instead because I remember very few choices and most were pretty mundaned.
I would've liked to have to worry about working out for Track, or studying for exams, or just working on ways to appear more feminine.
It's not bad, i'm more upset I messed up my first go. I just see this having more potential then it did.

review: Let's not kid ourselves here, man. If you're on the steam store browsing for visual novels, you literally have nothing better to do than fantasize about an alternate reality where you're actually popular with the opposite sex. And maybe you like to read, too. Maybe you like to judge a girl by her bust and gams, and then hook up with your school principal while cross dressing. Whatever your story is, you don't have anything to lose by trying out the vn Highschool Romance. So give it a go man. Or just, you know, kill yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096657845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1481432277}
review:
This is the light-hearted comedy of the series. Whereas Negligee is the sexy game and Possession is high in drama and catharsis, this is the one where you're in it for the laughs. In other words, exactly what I wanted.

As a VN, it's good - your choices matter (for the most part), and even the ones that don't necessarily affect the final result can still get you some different CGs. Furthermore, while there is merit to playing through a few times to get different endings and deciding which waifu is best, it isn't a huge investment of time to do that so it doesn't feel like a chore.

Finally, it's big on the "You are you, your clothing doesn't matter." and how sometimes you don't even need to care about your gender identity. Honestly I'd like to see more things push this message, and as someone who had identity troubles in her teen years and early adulthood, things like this might have been able to help me be more comfortable with me. It sends a positive message there, to coincide with the fun characters and silly moments.

If you're just in it for boob-touching, this isn't the right game (again, see Negligee for that one). If you dig things like Ranma 1/2, Kampfer and Asa Made Jugyo Chu! (the concept, not the "how close to a hentai can we get?" aspect), then I strongly suggest you play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300784276', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1483148901}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995411136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1480377158}
review:
Male protagonist; three female romance options. Crossdressing!

This game is great, albeit short and with only a few endings to achieve. I think two particular things make is worth the time and money: the art and the premise behind it. 

The art is extremely attractive and has a sort of pleasantly colorful cartoony vibe that is slightly anime but slightly western in appearance - all the characters are cute in their own way and the exaggerated expressions really give it a friendly, sweet-hearted feel. The unlockable scenes are all gorgeous and for the most part unique from another and not just the character posed on a static background that you see sometimes, I am particular fond of one scene where the protagonist and one of the girls are playing tennis for a reason I can't quite put my fingers on, I just really like it. Of course there are some sexy ones too, particularly of girls in underwear!

The concept is, as far as I know, fairly unique to Steam and so for a fan of cute boys in skirts, like myself, it is one of the few things that can scratch that particular itch. The only other somewhat similar game I can think of, which I will not mention, is extremely cringe inducing even to my incredibly deviant mind. So I more or less have to give this game gets even more props in the concept department for simply not going totally foot in mouth with it. Such is the state of the genre of cute boys in skirts.

The story is unfortunately far from exceptional. Two of the primary romantic interests are flat and contrived respectively, but the third was a pleasant surprise. I had gone in presuming I'd have more fun and interest in pursuing the more quiet, introverted character, as I often do, but unfortunately found her to be kind of flat and dull. The extroverted athletic girl on the other hand surprised me completely with both her slightly aggressive pursuit of you and how she interacts with the initial premise of the game. The third and final romantic option is a little crazy but I guess why make a hidden route normal? I liked it second best, after the athletic girl.

However, my main criticism of the story is the fact that it is a story about a boy who is crossdressing but at the same time it definitely isn't a story about crossdressing. Relatively little time is spent on the sort of difficulties such a situation would really have. It feels a lot like that in girl's clothes Shoji is immune to all suspicion. Voice, shaving, feminine behavoirs - all these things are more or less shrugged aside with only showers being the weak spot in his disguise. However, I don't think the cute, happy art style was really suited to a more serious examination of the subject matter.

My secondary criticism is that fact that a single very early choice seems to lock off two of the four endings. It's always a shame to go in and not being sure who to pursue and to find out by the end that one or more of the options will result in failure due to an early choice. I could be wrong about this, but in my first play through I pursued one of the girl's and didn't manage to get the good ending despite taking prettying much all her options in the mid and late game.

Also, one last thing. I don't think it's necessarily a bad thing there was no m/m route, given the trope of crossdressing being linked to gay men is tired, I still would have appreciated the option if it were available. It would have been cute as hell in this art!

review:
This game is a bit strange.. i played this twice because the first time i got no one. I tried it a second time focusing on one person and still got no one.. strange very long and a bit dragged out.  way more hype over something i did some what enjoy the game overall wasn't bad.
Plot: 4/10  wasn't really one just don't get caught a possibly find a bae?
Character Design: 6/10 The characters were kind of bland.. they had some good points but not enough in my opinion
Graphics: 9/10 Something i really liked about the game was the art style. I love the art style it is very cute and cartoony.
Overall: 6/10 honestly this game just didn't do it for me. Maybe i'll decide to replay it but honestly only if i had nothing else to do..

author: {'steamid': '76561198300685313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1487781588}
review:
I have never reviewed a VN before, so here goes:

Overall, I did like the story and plot, although there were times there were a lot of continuity errors. Like you're reading a piece of dialogue, and then all of a sudden, the very next dialogue appears,and it is presumed that time passed.  What happened during that time? There would have been opportunity to expand the story a little. There are some minor grammatical errors here.
I would have also like to have seen slightly more expansion in the ending, depending on what ending you get. The CG is good. [spoiler] Hoshi is kinda cute, though...[/spoiler]

Bottom Line: Slightly expensive, but good story. Could use a little more expansion though.

Grade: [b]C+[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024930583', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1474855349}
review:
I rather like this game overall, its far from perfect. There are few choices and some of the choices don't seem to matter a whole lot as things seem to happen a certain way no matter the path chosen. But that's where my biggest complaint is. I feel this game needs more choices, more points to decide Shoji's fate. There are times like it feels like its setting up a choice but it gets brushed over or decided for me; or how it feels like some questions should be allowed to answer. 

Beyond that, this is a short fun game. Not a whole lot of replayability, but there is just enough here to enjoy for those that like this kind of genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138926539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1472621811}
review:
The only way I'd recommend this game is at half the price it's being sold at. I bought it from Humble Bundle at about 20% off and even $7.99 was asking a little much. 
The first playthrough should take anywhere from an hour to two hours. From there, if you decide to replay the game, (which you will if you want to follow other romantic paths) you have the option to skip over dialogue scenes you've previously encountered and can reduce gameplay down to a half hour per playthrough. 
There is not a lot of player-made-decisions in this game. You get to make a choice between two options maybe five to ten times throughout the game and sometimes your choices don't seem to matter at all. 
My favorite thing about the game was the unique art style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012266476', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1472775708}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076200619', 'num_games_owned': 1699, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1472466017}
review:
I got this game from a bundle sold through Indie-Gala, all games came from the same publisher and had SteamOS/Linux support. Since I like Anime it looked like a good deal and it would allow me to experience these type of games (visual, interactive novels) for the first time.
To start, I picked a game that had a good score and did not focus on nudity, this one seemed to be popular, get many positive reviews and there is even a sequel in the works as I write this.
The premise is simple enough; boy dresses up as a girl and must avoid detection. Many great movies have been made on this topic, such as the classics; 'Some like it hot', 'Tootsie' and 'Mrs. Doubtfire'. Not for nothing all these are comedies providing great laughs for all ages. Needless to say, i was expecting something along these lines from this game. Sadly, none of the thrills that the before mentioned movies provide are witnessed here. The story is rather bland, missing a lot of opportunities to make it more interesting or funny. A lot of times I was thinking things could get interesting, but the plot was not further developed at that point. Ofcourse at some points you get to make choices in the game, but the outcome is rather predictable, so there is not much to it. At certain times i was expecting the ability to have a choice, but it didn't happen and the game already made the choice for me, as it was a set plot. A lot of missed opportunities throughout the game, which is very short as well.
What's left are the graphics and music, and they are nice. certainly the music is fitting the game very well. The graphics are also very well done, but there are not a lot of them, only a handful of locations and characters, so you might end up being tired of seeing them again and again after an hour.
Did I like my first encounter with a visual novel? Not very much, at the end I was wishing there be tits in it to at least get some excitement or something to giggle about.
Game works flawless on SteamOS/Linux, it probably works very well on lower end hardware since it's basically just showing pictures and text. No issues playing this game with the Steam Controller or streaming it to the Steam Link.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141804718', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1472494759}
review:
I am  going to give High school romance a postive  review.




 But  with a few  warnings there is  no nudity   or sex scenes in this very short visual novel .    Unless you count  a picture of soji 

getting kissed as a sex scene   . This vn feels like it has been edited for steam but there does not seem to be   an  unedited 

vershon with nudity  . It takes your basic  story of your socially  awkward virgin male . Arriving at  an institution filled with girls 

where he ends up  being romanced by each of the girls depending on which choices you make .There are 3 girls in the vn and 3 

endings  the twist being that he dresses as a girl  because he has been accepted as a student at an all girls school .  
The animation  character type that would describe the main character soji would be Dandere (see link below for varous animation 

charachter types.). All 3 girls are  character types we have seen many times before . However  the question I have to ask is did i 

like playing this and the answer is yes .  It is very short  and easy to play does not have very much variation in the bacground 

music but does have a  function to turn off the background music  off  .
 I would wait for it to go on sale  .  As  once you  unlock all the achievements  and pictures it does not have much replay value    
  
However on a personal level I like  how this  vn  breaks down    social stereotypes of   what  boys and girls are supposed to do.  


I especially like some of the lines in it where the  female character's . who know soji is a boy  pretty much tell him that his sexual 

identity does not make a difference as to who he is as a person .  
 
 
but  I especially like one line in this vn spoiler alert  
 
when  soji confesses to one girl that he is a male. She  says she knew that but she treated him like a girl becase she thought he 

"identified as a girl"    
 
 
http://kotaku.com/how-to-identify-popular-japanese-character-types-1169085239

author: {'steamid': '76561198066499877', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1472516574}
review:
TLDR at the end.

So this is a romantic no homo trap VN, you are the trap here. For particular reasons, (mostly lazyness) you accept crossdressing for a entire year. This is about the game. 
Now, about its content. Before I start, I must say I had another expectations for this game, that didnt change the way I percieve the game tho. 
For whatever the reason is , you might find true love during this last year of school, like in real life, you could be finding good friends right now, working on yourself for a brighter future, even better, finding the love of your life now, or reading this review. Independent of the time-set however, the story development deploys naturally and makes sense.
This situation you got into might not make something you will easily pull out, but it happens. Now the whole story deveploment makes the most natural sense ever, I think that just one option didnt go as expected, every other desicion you make brings reasonable consecuences (good and bad).
I have a freind who is working in a project similar to this one, I dont want to got into details, but has a comedy turn, most than a romantic turn. Still, I have a good alike for romantic stories, when they are well written.

TLDR Most decisions make sense. It's a nice ride if you are into VNs, or romantic stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028724797', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1472470190}
review:
Questa √® stata un'altra visual novel che ho gradito giocare. 
Sei un ragazzo obblgato a frequentare un college femminile... quindi dovrai vestirti e comportarti come una ragazza... e, ovviamente, incontrerai un paio di ragazze interessanti... ;)

Le scelte che farai condurranno a finali diversi, e anche quelli negativi non sono terribili. Mi √® piaciuto come il gioco sia in qualche modo verosimile anche se √® praticamente impossibile che qualcosa del genere possa mai capitare. 

Comunque la storia √® ben raccontata, ci sono alcuni dialoghi interessanti e i personaggi, bench√© stereotipizzati, non sono solo un clich√©. 

Non √® difficile ottenere tutti i finali positivi, ma √® stato piacevole leggere la storia un paio di volte per ottenerli tutti e tre. Non saprei dire qual √® il mio preferito perch√© sono tutti buoni. 

Consiglio questo gioco solo alle persone a cui piacciono le storie d'amore. 

Direi che √® un gioco per ragazze, ma questo significherebbe che non ho imparato nulla da questo gioco riguardo la rottura degli stereotipi sessuali. 

+ Buona storia d'amore
+ Personaggi interessanti
+ Non stupido nonostante la premessa 
+ 5 finali

- Avrei apprezzato pi√π immagini

author: {'steamid': '76561197976515384', 'num_games_owned': 1691, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 2471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2471, 'last_played': 1471896851}
review:
Well honestly after taking a few days on and off at playing this due to the lack of real interest in the story I feel like I can write a review. I wanted to be fair in my review of the game so I made sure to play it to every ending. When I first started playing one thing that really annoyed me was the skip mode and I couldn't for the life of me understand why it didn't work.

It was only after my second play did I notice it only lets you use the skip function if you have already seen that text before. At first this was going to be a bad mark against the game for me when I started however after getting use to it I can understand how it was handy and enjoyed it around the third run.

While I have both good and bad things to say about this game. I am torn on if I would recommend the game. One thing I did enjoy about the game was the stroy line it was very interesting and not something I have seen in a visual novel before however at the same time its a rather generic idea. The backgrounds and bodies are drawn very well and the game has no bugs that I could find.

Now for some of the bad things the faces were all drawn just awful the game has zero voice acting and no real change in music as far as I could tell. The brackgrounds didn't always fit the sence they were ment to be and the stroy was VERY short.

So now the real question would I recommend this game... Yes I would but only if the price is right while I can understand the amount of time and effort the devs would have put into this game do I think its worth ten bucks? No not really the game feels closer to three or five dollars at the most and even five feels like a bit of a reach. The game itself doesnt offer enough for the price mark they have it in. While the art and story are nice it can only carry the price so far before you need some content. The one thing I did enjoy at the very end of this is no matter your ending they wrapped up the story line so you were not left wondering what happens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066851749', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1470881887}
review:
You could call me a fan.
Only the second visual novel i've every played. And the first was Sakura Spirit that i got as joke for christmas...
The grammar mistakes are minimal. There's like, 3 spelling errors in the entire thing and they're actually not dialogue wrecking. 
Speaking of the dialogue, it just runs smoothly. It feels like manga but it's still obviously western, and in a good way. 
Idk, if you're new like I am, you'll enjoy it. All of the characters are cute. And if it's on sale, definitely grab it if you want a nice (albeit short) visual novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066112235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1470052237}
review:
Music, art and color is really cute and appealing. But it bothers me that you don't actually get to choose much in the game yourelf. The characters will ask a question, and after a long time of playing you'll think "finally I can choose something" but the main character you play as just kind of acts on its own. It's cute and nice for just reading and looking at pictures (some scenes don't even have any pictures though, which have annoyed me as well), but over all I'm feeling like I don't really accomplish anything with this. 
Cute idea though, but definitely needs way more interractions for it to capture. At least for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005771904', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1469067066}
review:
Very good game, though it does have its flaws

1. There are no transistions between the majority of scenes. You are one place, and then without any warning you are in another place, or even another day entirely.

2. There is no distinction between what the main character is thinking, and what he is actually saying. This made it hard to follow the conversation sometimes.

3. Finally, lack of consistancy in the backgrounds with regards to time of day.

Despite these 3 complaints however I very much enjoyed this cute, albeit short, story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319072900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1468933938}
review:
Let me clarify.  I don't like this game much but for what I spent on it (5 dollars) I didn't fee too bad about playing it beyond the ablity to return it since I was interested till the end of the game.

Now maybe the appeal of this game outside of steam is sex scenes or something that are missing for obvious reasons.  But that just leave the actual part of the game that should make you buy it since getting it just for fap material is stupid as you'd easily just find free stuff online.

Now on to the review...

My main issue with the game is text.  With no voice overs you will be reading a lot, and many times there will be internal monologues by the main character in italics.  The problem is the italics are so small a change I couldn't tell when what was what till I paid attention more or just assumed from what makes sense the most with what was said.  This means it was a choir to read and that's before getting into one of the paths being so simplified and wish granting that I can't handle caring about it.

It's a cheap game that can't be bothered to have more than the 4 characters with designs in the game.  And the fact outside the main character the other three are his partner options just makes it hard to engage.  No generic NPC even in the script really makes the story feel small and doesn't help with the tone at all.

If you can get it on sale and want a cheap Visual Novel to get an idea of what the genre is or are out of other options I say this is a good get.  Just realize that it's one of the worst examples in the genre since even if it did have sex scene they would have to be written has the hottest things known to the genre to even compete with have the other things on steam.

review: I felt this game was simply lacking overall.  It didn't really feel engaging, or particularly interesting: I didn't really connect much with the characters or the story.  It was pretty bland, and also short: while I don't mind short games, but that is a pretty hefty price tag for such a short, lackluster game (I did get it on sale, but even so... I don't think I'd recommend it).  It wasn't super terrible or anything like that, but there is much better out there, for the same price or cheaper.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998981530', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1707444630}
review:
Advance notice, I am writing this review having only played about 5 minutes of the game initially, but there's already some pros and cons to the game I want shared, particularly to the devs that are worth mentioning, especially if this game is moving on to a second iteration.

Initial impressions:
The game/novel appears to be colorful and vibrant, and the text style choice has an appealing design to it.  The UI seems spot on.  I start reading and I'm in the character's head, but then as soon as we get to the principal's office, I'm suddenly surprised at the Principal's response.  There was no indication of items being said vs being thought.  It was jarring to need to spend that extra moment to pay the closer attention to tell what can be taken intuitively by a little more setup or preparation.
The art was has a very unique style, and it has its own lull appeal to it, though at times it had me slightly repelled.  My preferences in what I'd want to see could be overlooked, because it's so different, but there became a few other issues with the art so far.  One is just how little the characters differ in form/posture.  Maybe I'm not far enough in yet, but as an example, the main character we're following says the principal says something 'so brightly' yet there's not a single change in the smile, eyes, or posture to indicate that it was remotely true.  It'd be demeaning to say that the artists or the designers are not aware of how humans behave, but based on the work done, it doesn't appear that the knowledge has been applied to the game.

overall first impression rating: 3/5

Pros: 
+Decent enough start, if a bit typical.  One can only expect so many possibilities for how a scenario could occur.
+Unique art style.  I'm on the fence on the pro vs con of it, but it is what led me to get the game anyway

Cons:
-Poses, or lack thereof. All 2 of the poses seen (I know, so fair right?) are basically just a moved arm and a change to the face in the eyes and mouth.  Very statuesque, and the poses themselves are uninteresting for the character and the principal. Full front pose with unnatural/unlikely arm held to the side of the body needs some fixing.  (I'll lump the offputting eyes close to the bridge of the nose in with this as well as the rather large boobs in this, as it's all character related)
- Difficulty in separating thought from speech.

Recommendations to devs:
1) Fix the thought-speech separation.  Perhaps leaving the name off of the top of the box to indicate speech vs thought.  It's likely going to be automagically interpreted as thought if text is proceeding without the name, as so far, we're following the perspective of the main character.
2) This fix requires more effort, and may need to just wait until HR2, but research or act on the knowledge about poses.  Create subtle differences in stance for the characters, move more than just an arm or change an expression.  Look into a relatively recent (from the perspective of this review) video from Extra Frames (video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZmLkVtqjf1A ) regarding pose design, or look into Katawa Shoujo.  I don't expect this, or its sequel, to be KS, but from a design standpoint, notice how frequently the characters shift, even though nothing's particularly active, you get a sense of movement and involvement from all the characters, even Rin (the no armed one).

I hope that this helps the devs, or anyone else who may be designing or working on similar projects, to progress.  It's a lot more work, but it's worthwhile because it helps bring the characters to life, and this initial impression, while I'm reading into some things a bit much for only 5 minutes, is leading me to expectations about what will happen, and that's critical to getting anyone's attention, reader or gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116585298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1461539538}
review:
"So Shoji...are you a lesbian" -Selina/Blondie I want to break your ass bombshell, first 12 minutes of gameplay, dead serious.

TL;DR  : BUY THIS GAME ONLY IF IT HAS A DISCOUNT AND IF YOU ARE INTO VNs. CHARMING YET SIMPLE STORY, BUSTY BABES, NO NUDITY, LITTLE TO NO REPLAY VALUE 

Highschool Romance is a VN...and from there I don't know what can stand out when you compare it to other VN's. The story unfolds, you watch, you get to do some decisions which won't impact the plot at all, just the ending, but then again, when the title says what's this about, this is what you get.

While I find the main plot as something done a thousand times before, it manages to engage you with enough charm on it's simplicity and waifu material. Characters have some good traits to them, but, aside from one, I never felt that any of them were anything beyond stereotypes. 

My only real problem with this game is that I find little to no replay value, I can only see a comitted completionist finishing this game with all endings, and after that, I don't see him picking it up again. A real shame because the visuals give the game a personality of its own.

BUT my main complain is why didn't the devs make any freaky fakkin' nudity content/patch?! I know Steam would rather have me eviscerating one of this vixens before seeing their nipples but, come on Lord Gaben!! This is the kind of game that I play with the mouse in my left hand and a bottle of wax in the right one. With the crossdressing, the silly dialogue, the busty schoolgirls, the cliches I'm almost expecting a porn movie with Johny Sins as Shoji! Serioulsy, some H content would have boosted the replay value, and perhaps added some depth to the character's relationships (it's about love right?).

Yeah, yeah, there's a sequel with actual nudity but no, I don't like it's visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023856019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1461127329}
review:
So, I gotta start by saying that the review by The_Fresh_Prince is the reason why I got this game. His review was 10/10 IGN... Unfortunately, that was the best part about this game. I got HS Romance during a sale for 5 bucks - granted I played for almost 5 hours, I feel like I was slightly jipped. Why? Because the reviews made me think I was in for a crazy adventure that was just insane in every aspect. What I ended up getting was actually a relatively tame visual novel that told a relatively average quality story with little artwork and a short completion time. This makes it sound like I'm ragging on the game, but really, I think it was worth the $5 I payed for it. Just allow me to explain WHY this game was enjoyable - actually and truly.
1.) The art that's there is really pretty and has a unique style. The girls are cute and the environments colorful (even if both are repetitive)
2.) You actually do have some choices to make that effect the endgame. None of the choices are groundbreaking, but they DO make a difference
3.)Because the content isn't as risqu√© as some reviews would have you believe, I played this for a stream with a couple of friends. We had plenty of laughs and were able to stay entertained for most of the title.

TL;dr? It's pretty and has cute girls, but the nudity tag is a lie. Game is worth on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561197995841541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1460867505}
review:
The character interactions pulled me into this game.  As I played and made choices I found myself part of the story and I became very interested in what the outcome would be.  Also, although I could never be Shoji, I could never pull off pretending to be a woman,  the various characters and romance pulled me into the story.  Of course when I made my choices dividing time between both girls I ended up with neither of them as in real life. 

So I read the achievement guides and followed the Selina True Love scenario:  a Feminist choice: she spends her time teaching Shoji how to be her boyfriend.     Now he does not know if he wears dresses because she wants him to or because he likes it.  She wears the pants and he wears the dress.  She is the husband and he is the wife.  I would never have gotten this achievement if not for reading how to get it.  It just would not work for me.

Lea True Love:  the woman who is the principal and gym teacher: looks more like a model than a principal. Lea is an older woman who sneaks around flirting with Shoji trying on sexy bras and panties in front of him asking for his opion.  Then she kisses him.  In the end they get married and live happily ever after.  In both Selina and Lea True Love scenarios they both like to see Shoji in womans clothing and continue to dress Shoji up as a female.

Hoshi True Love:  Shoji does not have to wear the dress to entertain Hoshi and a happy ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001452031', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1458446858}
review:
There are things you take for granted when you're reading VNs, that you miss when absent.  Screen transitions between scenes and days.  A distinctive text difference between your actual speech and your inner thoughts besides italics which you can barely distinguish.  Backgrounds that change based on time and location.  A pacing which lets you take your time and enjoy the experience before it's suddenly over.  A readable text background that doesn't make your eyes hurt after a few minutes (seriously, that bright red is enough to blind someone...)

This game lacks all of those things.  It's a breakneck adventure with sudden jolts between scenes that is difficult to keep up with at times.  Whenever I started to feel myself enjoying the experience, I was jolted into another scene and the immersion was broken again.

As a first attempt at a game like this, it's not terrible.  A $10 price point for this 2 hour romp through a fairly token story is a little steep.  You wouldn't regret paying a buck or two for it if you're tired of trips to feels town and just want a light-hearted romp with a few girls.

I can't give a full recommendation in this state, but I'm still curious for the sequel.  If they smooth out some of the rough edges in the interface, learn about pacing, and make the game a little longer, Highschool Romance 2 could be a solid game.  This one just isn't quite there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013806302', 'num_games_owned': 3994, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1458007753}
review:
A cute story of a boy crossdressing in a girl's highschool.
Art is great and full of personality, music is good, no voice acting.

No real nudity or sex scene, only some underwear and kissing.
A bit short but enough to meet the characters since there are no secondary characters.

Only three romance paths, the third kind of hidden and you probably won't find it playing through the game normally since it require a pretty specific path. Only a few scenes are different and the overall story stay the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005753521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1459783368}
review:
"playing" a lot of visual novels, of many types, this one first struck me out with the art style. It was refreshing to the more common anime style.
The game takes place at an all-Girls School, where our main guy here ends up being stuck at for odd reasons. This is all about our main guy trying to keep his gender hidden for a full year at this school, and perhaps find love there.
It is not very long, and it skips a lot around. It only got 4 characters, including our main guy. And the music is very boring...
However! if you get past all that, and just read it for fun, it truely is. I really enjoyed the many dumb situations, and loved thinking of what I'd do myself in those situations. It is also one of the visual novels I've read that I actually felt good about the endings, and one of the few that have given me some great laughs.
This is not Katawa Shoujo levels of great, but it is worth a read if you got the money to spare, and ain't too narrow minded. (I hate number ratings so I'll give it this.) 74.7 Milky Way Crispy Rolls out of Muffins.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989223923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1455400747}
review:
First, let's get the bad out there. It is short for the money, but as you'll see, it's worth it in the long run. 

Now the good. The storyline itself is formulaic, but the plot is AMAZING. I went in to this game optimistic that it wasn't going to be one of those sketchy harem games where the "boy" is just trying to get his wick dipped. The developers did not disappoint; the protag has definite dimension and‚Ä¶ personality. I'm actually not sure if this was actually a surreptitious way to introduce a transgender protag or not; Shoji certainly seemed to take on the feminine role very quickly‚Ä¶ and almost too well. I love that the developers actually reference this in one of the potential endings, though it isn't as strong as it could be (which is all I'm going to say, as I can't divulge any more without actually spoiling it).

All in all, I have to say that this was a pretty epic win. I have taken some chances on other otome games, and some have been good (such as Michaela Laws' [i]Seduce Me[/i]), and others that weren't so great (and I'll not make mention of them here). I'm pleased to say that this one is in the former category. I find myself actually looking forward to the sequel. I spoke with the developers (who are very responsive in the forums), and I like some of the ideas they have for it. We need more trans characters placed in a good light, and I think they get that.

Final verdict: Is it worth your time? Hell yes. This is a great story that warms my heart. My profile background has recently changed to Hoshi, and my desktop background is Selina and Shoji in the park. That's how much I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025724642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1456176849}
review:
This game would really only interest a real anime fan that enjoys finding more LGBT oriented stories and characters; not at all something to interest a casual anime "davvler" i guess would be a good word to use and someone not of the supportive LGBT variety. Its a visual novel about a androgynous boy that is mistakenly transferred to a once co-ed boarding school that is now an all girl school. So naturally the best course of action is to just go with and pretend to be a girl with the full consent and help of the principal. We've all been there once or twice right? By the way it is of course a visual novel, that means really its just a picture book that will have you spneding all your time reading and clicking your mouse just to turn the page. Ocassionaly you will have to choose what your character decides to do for what situation hes in, which is just to determine which girl you want to end up with

The 4 main characters--including you--are basically the common cliche, cookie cutter anime stereotypes found in alot of anime: Youre the androgynous "male" character that ALREADY looks like a female, yet somehow doesn't realize it and thinks he's a man's man, there's the softspoken shy over-academic glasses girl--with big boobs, the outspoken sporty competitive girl--with big boobs, and your hot-blooded principal/teacher that's actually SUPPOSED to be an older woman but looks and dresses like a teenager and has a thing for barely legal young men--of course with big boobs. But i still felt they were nicely designed characters.

The story as well is just as cliche but tells itself well enough, its a shame its not just a full flegded animation. You fall ontop of girls in awkward intimate ways, you spill things on their big boobs, youre forced to make decisions between them, etc. Your character, while supposed to be heterosexual and cisgendered, somewhat discovers he can "enjoy" transvestite activites at least during 2 of your interests' paths (alot of people dont know a transvestite actually has nothing to do with homosexuality or transexuality) but thats really all the "character" developement that happens. However i cant in good faith advocate this as a truly lesbian or transgender novel because its not supposed to be despite it giving that impression.

Pros: 
-It has a great bright vibrant artstyle that i absolutely love (perhaps even a bit too bright enough to hurt your eyes). 
-The girls have nice designs--especially Lea (omfg i want her clothes... ;_;)
-Is a sweet romance anime novel
-I personally rather enjoyed the girls personalities. Selina specifically i feel is the best and strongest character that probably makes the story as interesting as it can be, with Lea being the second.
-If you look nicely drawn boobs, then the story has nicely drawn boobs on sexy ladies
-Silly and humorous


Cons:
-The whole grounds the story is based on is stupid i have to say. Thats not me necessarily saying its bad, but it is something that would ONLY happen in anime. 
-Notice how i kept saying the girls are nice characters with the exception of the character the story is taking perspective of right? Thats because the guy is not a great character at all that doesnt really have any terribly interesting qualities or talents that the other characters have to read about whether that was intentional or not. Not much is learned about him besides what you begin the game knowing about him in otherwords and thats how each story ends
-The music while it is sweet and cute, is too few in variation and gets a little annoying after how long they go on and how often theyre used. It was especially annoying when youre reading something really intimate and mature happening between the main character and one of his interests and theres this really cheery upbeat tune playing to it that sounds like you should be reading about a little girl having a tea party.
-No sex in case thats something you were expecting. It's strictly romance with some saucy moments, but nothing involving intercourse.
-This visual novel was made to particularly interest anime enthusiasts that like romance, underlying LGBT stories and characters. If thpse things don't interest you this game novel most assuredly will not

Final verdict: 5.7/10. I genuinely did enjoy it for the story so i give it a thumbs up based on *my* interests. Lea and and Selina are great vibrant characters that are most of the interest to be found here while you are not in my opinion. There could have been more done with the story and the main character i feel. With that said i will certainly look forward to what the publisher is working on next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017131714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1456057278}
review:
I enjoy the occasional VN and have extensively played some of the huge ones on the market (Muv-Luv trilogy, Fate/Stay, Kamidori Alchemy meister, etc.) and found Highschool Romance to be alright.


Overall, the game has 4 achievements (one for each ending and a 'secret' achievement) and 18 unlockable CGs. The gameplay is typical to all VNs I have played though they were missing one of the more important features to a VN. I was unable to scroll up to view previous text, which is generally a hallmark of VNs. 

For grabbing the game at around ~$6.75, I spent 6 hours 100%ing it. I found that a price of $5-7 range is the best for this game since it isn't particularly long and somewhat repetitive. There are about 4 background tracks tops and sometimes they do not fit the scene they play in which can convey the wrong kind of atmosphere to the reader imo. Another aspect that fit in the okay, not exceptional category is that I think there are... 6? background CGs tops. Not to mention that the character's writing  would have benefit way more from a longer game.


Basically it boils down to:
* Not many background CGs
* 3-4 music tracks tops
* Music did not fit some scenes
* Characters were a little shallow, leading into
* Game should have been longer for better character depth


Despite the flaws, I did enjoy the art style and the story was certainly alright, though reactions to certain things were a bit disappointing. Get it if you are new to the visual novels genre and would like to give it a try for cheap

Rating would be about 3.5 out of 5

lea best grill

author: {'steamid': '76561198047527182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1456012073}
review:
I tried very hard to like this game, but in the end I was left disappointed. I have a lot to say, both in terms of the Pros and Cons, so I'll list them out for the sake of convenience.

Pros:
*The artwork is very nice and detailed.

*All the characters are somewhat likeable.

*Offers dialogue options.

*Girls are cute.

Cons:
*Although the artwork is very well done, there is not enough of it. Most if it is just the same artwork with a clothing change, like a sports bra instead of a normal bra, and it's disappointing overall.

*The dialogue is honestly awful. The way the plot progresses and is paced is poor, and there are many grammatical mistakes in the text that make some sentences hard to understand.

*There are only 3 girls, and I found all of them boring and honestly too perfect to believe. It actually makes me harder to like characters if they have literally no flaws to them whatsoever.

*The endings are disappointing/terrible based on which one you get. The amount of boring text I had to get through to reach the crappy end was definitely not worth it.

*Even though there are dialogue choices, I've noticed most of them don't change the story much and are just there to make you THINK you are making an important decision.

*Price is too high for the production value of the game.

Conclusion:

Overall, this game has a lot more negatives than positives, and I feel that this game is not deserving of its price tag. Compared to Huniepop, which has voice acting, animations, engaging dialogue, more characters, and doubles as a super addicting puzzle game, this game definitely disappoints.

5/10
I do not recommend purchasing this for over 5 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009713169', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1455849603}
review:
It's very sweet and I adore all of the characters. However, while I do heartily recommend this, I feel I need to mention one thing that bothered me: the pacing--or rather, the utter lack thereof. Everything seems to come straight on the heels of the thing before, even if there was a significant time jump between. I really understand this, being an amateur writer myself. Often you have a string of moments you've fleshed out that you want to get into in a story--the meat and potatoes of the "meal", so to speak--and it can be hard to string them together. However, this game eschews that for simply placing them one after the other, lightning fast, with very little in the way of segue. As much as I liked the story and all of the characters in it, this constantly pierced my willing suspension of disbelief. I felt like I was being shown a slideshow-in-text rather than someone's, y'know, *life*. 

All in all, though, I really did enjoy it. I just wanted to chime in with some constructive criticism in case writer-senpai notices me. I hear there's talk of a sequel, and I'll definitely buy it when it's on sale. 

My verdict: As long as you don't mind a jarring pace, get it when it's on sale. 

Also, Hoshi best girl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055200382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1486357222}
review:
*Short Version*

At the time of writing this I only have 3.7 hours logged for this game. Despite that, I have completed all three of the story arcs including both good and ‚Äúbad‚Äù endings.

It's a nice little visual novel. However, it left me wanting several things, especially if you compare it to something like Katawa Shoujo. Overall I would rate it 6/10 but I would not recommend the game to a friend in the current state that it‚Äôs in.

However, if it‚Äôs on sale then for it.


*Long Version*

*Cons*

-There are several lines of dialogue that should have been used as choices. I don't know if it's just me, but I would prefer a choice of telling someone if I'm a lesbian. Instead I'm given choices like "tennis" or "running."

-There is a severe lack of endings. There's only three routes and five endings in the game. Either add more characters or truly devastating bad endings instead of the neutral like "bad" endings. Also with the addition of more characters, it would allow other endings to close off easier and make the choices in game more meaningful.

-More character flaws would be nice too. Everyone was a "Mary Sue" and gave me no real reason to become attached to a character. What's worse is that there's a lot of opportunities in the plot that would allow for the development of flaws, which brings me to my next point...

-The plot seemed rushed. There are so many good events or problems that could have been expanded upon, like when Hoshi is doing other people's homework. This subplot gets dropped within the same scene and never brought up again. There are countless more examples of this and makes a game that could have been 4-6 hours long take only 2.

-The art doesn't always match what's going on in the background. If dialogue says that it's dark, I don't want to see bright blue skies in the background! Also the only still pictures used are for either kisses or underwear scenes. It would be nice to actually see the board games that you're playing with Hoshi or the fireworks that are in the sky during the festival. In addition, there's not a lot of character models with different expressions. It‚Äôs hard to take the scenes seriously when Selina or Hoshi is supposed to be mad but their faces are smiling.

-The music is annoying after hearing it over and over again. It's too simple and short to hear constantly.

-The transition of time is awful. Several times the game moved on to the next day. But because there are no visual cues or even change of lighting, it‚Äôs hard to follow when that happens. Just the screen fading to black for a second would be better.

-There should be an interface to recall previous dialogue. If you skip something you have to either revert to an old save or start over from the beginning.


*Pros*

-This game has a lot of potential. It has an interesting concept and a decent story. I really enjoyed Lea's path.

-The art is actually really nice. I just wish I was able to see more of it. I really wanted to see Shoji and Hoshi sing karaoke.

-It takes a delicate and controversial idea and doesn‚Äôt butcher it.



Overall I would give it a 6/10 as of right now. What I would really like to see before the release of the sequel is a more fleshed out version of this. If that were to happen then this game would easily be 9/10.

review:
„ÄäHighschool Romance„ÄãÊòØ‰∏ÄÊ¨æ‰ª•Ê†°ÂúíÊàÄÊÑõÂñúÂäáÁÇ∫‰∏ªÈ°åÁöÑË¶ñË¶∫Â∞èË™™ÈÅäÊà≤ÔºåÊïÖ‰∫ãË¨õËø∞È´òÊ†°Áîü Shoji Âõ†Áà∂ÊØçËôïÁêÜËΩâÂ≠∏ÊâãÁ∫å‰ΩúÊ•≠‰∏ÄÊôÇÁñèÂøΩÈô∞ÈåØÈôΩÂ∑Æ‰æÜÂà∞‰∏ÄÈñìÂ•≥Â≠êÈ´ò‰∏≠ÔºåÂπ¥ËºïÂ•≥Ê†°Èï∑ Lea Rowen Ê±∫ÂÆöÂ∞áÈåØÂ∞±ÈåØÂëΩ‰ª§ Shoji Á©øËëóÂ•≥Ë£ùÂÅáÊâÆÊàêÂ•≥Â≠∏ÁîüÔºåÈõñÁÑ∂Ë™™Â•≥Ë£ùÈ°åÊùêÂ∑≤Á∂ìÂú®Êó•Êú¨È¢®Ë°åÂ•Ω‰∏ÄÈô£Â≠êÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂú®Ê≠êÁæé‰ΩúÂìÅÁúãÂà∞Â¶ÇÊ≠§ÂäÉÊôÇ‰ª£Ë®≠ÂÆöÔºåÁ¢∫ÂØ¶ÊòØËÆìÁ≠ÜËÄÖÊ∏æË∫´Ëµ∑ÈõûÁöÆÁñôÁò©ÔºåËÄå‰∏îÂí±ÂÄëÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÁî∑‰∏ªËßí Shoji ÈÇÑÊúÉË∑ü‰∏âÂêçÂ•≥ÊÄßÂ¢úÂÖ•ÊÑõÊ≤≥‰øÆÊàêÊ≠£ÊûúÔºåÁ©∂Á´üÂ•≥Ë£ùÂ∞ëÂπ¥Ë∑üÂ•≥Â≠©Â≠êË´áÊàÄÊÑõË©≤Á®±‰ΩúÁî∑Â•≥Áï∞ÊÄßÊàÄÈÇÑÊòØËïæÁµ≤ÈÇäÂ•≥ÂêåÊÄßÊàÄÂë¢ÔºüËÆìÊàëÂÄëÁπºÁ∫åÁúã‰∏ãÂéªÂ∞±Áü•ÈÅìÁ≠îÊ°àÂï¶ÔºÅ

review:

Or maybe it's just me who knows?

I bought this game on a discount.
It's not worth 9.99‚Ç¨, but it's worth playing through at least once for the discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122320895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1457658837}
review:
[h1]A short visual novel that does not get sleazy[/h1]
You play as Shoji and you can follow along and become romantic with the sporty, straight forward, blonde Selina, the polite, cute, raven-haired Hoshi or the busty principal ms. Rowen. The game is tagged with nudity, but there is none of that in the game. Luckily I think, otherwise it would have lost its charm with me.

===

I really like the artwork of this game, the characters all look amazing. Sometimes you get a little piece of extra artwork of a scene in the story.
Sadly, there were many times while reading the story I wanted to actually see that scene drawn on the screen rather than just the character sprite explaining it to me in just text. The backgrounds are all devoid of any life, maybe not to distract you from the main characters, but this school just looked empty to me.

Basically make the choices toward the girl you like between Selina and Hoshi. With ms. Rowen you will have to be a bit more daunting. To make another playthrough easier, a handy skip button allows you to quickly pass all the text you already have read. 

===

I liked this game for its art style and the stories intertwined well with eachother. It did not become a sleazy story and all the characters were well written.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064066770', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1453310371}
review:
[i]Literally best gift for your male friends[/i]

Highschool. Someone hate it, someone love, but its part of our life and we cant ignore it.
So... Whats, if accident happens and your new school is girls-only? 
Some pervys can imagine it as harem, but this story isnt about it. Its about guy, who needs to crossdress into girl cuz of this situation. Sounds mad? Maybe, but if it wont scare you - just grab this. Or if you like 2D traps, like I d...nevermind :I

So, in short. 
Pros:
+ [b]Few routes[/b]. Yep, its not katawa shoujo, but here are 3 full endings (full = not when you ends with your hands only). Also few choises - not as much as could be, but also not like in sakura series :/
+ [b]Pretty graphics[/b]. Rlly - not another copy-paste, where every character looks same as other one in different title
+ [b]Fanservice[/b]. I know, lewds, you are here for it ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞) There is, actually, no nudity, but, atlest, no pg13 erotic too, like in sakura series (Im used this again, cuz its very popular in steam)
+ [b]Cards[/b]. Cuz this game is a bit niche, they have a bit higher price than they could be. Thats cool if you dont wanna to craft badge. 3 of 5 drops in game.

Mehs:
~ [b]A bit short[/b]. Im not fast reader, cuz english isnt my native language, so - I did 100% (all routes, all choises, all stuff in gallery) in like 4.5 hours (and one more hour farmed cards). Its not worst result for vn, but not best too.
~ [b]Plot[/b]. Im not fan of slices, so - it wasnt my coup of tea. But, for someone else its may be in pros, so - placed it here

Cons:
- [b]Not much sprites[/b]. Rlly. Not all action scenes have custom backgrounds actually, like if its censored (but it isnt). For not free vn, its not best thing.

Overall: its little, but [b]fun[/b] (rlly fun - some scenes made me laugh) [b]slice vn[/b], a bit cliched, but it looks different anyways, cuz of situation. 
In my opinion, its [b]must have for every trap-lovers and recommended for fans of slices[/b]. Also, as I said, its may be awesome to gift it to your male friends with stereotypes :^)

Anyways - Highschool Romance 2 announced and my body is ready :D

-----------------------------------------

PS: Selina > Lea > Hoshi. Shoji is out of ratings, cuz we all know he is best as every trap ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞)

author: {'steamid': '76561198134509422', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1450946076}
review:
So I bought this game out of impulse when I saw Chilled play it. Let me just say this game was my first Visual Novel. It has a great, if slightly generic, storyline and definitely worth picking up if you're new to Visual Novels like I was. "Nudity" is a rather misleading tag because the closest you get is underwear and lingerie. This fact is better, though, as players can focus less on mindless sex appeal and perhaps enjoy the story a bit more. Is it worth $10? Probably not. Is it worth playing, however? Absolutely.

Final recommendation: Shave a few dollars off this and it's definitely worth it. Full price, maybe, if you really want a quality Visual Novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066053084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1453281431}
review:
I'm totally satisfied! Had a great time. Let's look at pron and cons

+Excellent idea. It was fun
+Great setting. Background are well done
+Sexy characters. There're only three of them but I can't say for sure if it's bad
+Realistic dialogues and nice plot. Can't stop playing. Lots of funny jokes
+Lea. I'm so into that kind of relationship! Best ending, and takes more than one try to figure it out. 

+-Because of small amount of characters game isn't long. 6 hours, 4 tries, 3 good endings

review:
Highschool Romance is a delightful light romance game that follows our naive protagonist Shoji on his/her adventures at an all girls academy. Some expected and not-so-expected plot twists occur amidst gender bending hijinx.

While fun on its own, Highschool Romance is best enjoyed while the player is properly attired for an all girls academy. Actually, I think this game should come with a maid outfit, feather duster included. You'll know what I mean after a few playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042613011', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1588951811}
review:
Pros:
+Lovely Artwork and Character Designs in an appealing art style
+Talks about crossdressing in a semi-mature fashion
+Likable Characters

Cons:
-Way too expensive for the amount of hours it takes to beat
-Aside from the art the presentation is sloppy at times
-Despite being likable, the characters or story aren't terribly interesting

Highschool Romance is a dating sim where you play as the only boy in an all girls boarding school, all thanks to a mix up in the admission process. Because of this the main character Shoji has to pretend to be a girl. Now, when I first heard about this game, I was excited to find a game with a crossdressing protagonist as it's so rarely handled nowadays. But I was also very worried since whenever it is handled... well it's not usually handled particularly well.

High School Romance is actually very mature about the concept though and talks about it in a somewhat respectful manner. It presents you with a main character who, while obviously a touch hesitant about crossdressing at first, grows to accept it and learns something about himself. Occasionally it does delve into dressing up as a 'kink', but it treats it very equally, painting it not as humiliating but as 'sexy' on both sides.

Speaking of 'sexy', the artwork is lovely and the characters all look superb. This is a style I really love and the CGs are all really great. The presentation elsewhere however is lacking and feels a touch sloppy. There aren't enough expressions for each of the characters, there are typos, music doesn't always fit the scene and sometimes scene transitions are there, sometimes they aren't which can be a little jarring.

It's also exceptionally short, which makes the asking price somewhat hard to sell. It took me just less than 4 hours to fully complete it, which was in one sitting I might add. However, thanks to it's brevity and the sheer lightness of it's plot it's perfect for a quick fluffy time if you're ever feeling a little down.

And that's what this mostly is, a fluffy cute Dating Sim with crossdressing in it. And while it's not as developed as other VNs it is at least entertaining for what it is.

review:
There's a few hiccups here and there with the text (typos and such) but overall this is a really enjoyable story once the competition between the girls for your affections kicks in. Only two things I would be aware of before playing: the Gallery starts out with all the images unlocked, so you'll spoil story bits for yourself if you look through it before playing; and there's no history button (that I could find), so there's no way to reread what a character just said after you've clicked past it unless you have a recent save. Enjoy!

*I purchased this game through the publisher's website but I kept getting an error posting my review, so I'm reviewing it on Steam, if you're wondering why I don't have much playtime :)*

author: {'steamid': '76561198015025841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1451375289}
review:
herp derp muh hilarious anime premise

That is consequently forgotten and followed up by exceedingly boring slice of life of the blandest kind. Seriously. You don't advertise "You're a boy crossdressing at a female school!!" and then do literally nothing with that. Your target audience isn't normals. It's weebs. You get three routes, two of which are nearly identical, railroaded, and filled with so many lame timeskips and things like the game telling you this character you've seen twice is suddenly your best friend. It even offers a Mass Effect-style ending decision node. Really?

Story aside, this game has next to no art assets. There are 18 event CG in the entire game, and several of that number are literally the same scene, just with different underwear on. The main character is drawn as a girl and called a guy (No, seriously, he has childbearing hips and wears eyeliner in your first look at him). There are three characters that have sprites, three expressions for each, and three sets of clothes: School, Casual, and Underwear. Oh, I guess the Principle has a yukata too. The game frequently forgets that the characters actually have multiple expressions to choose from; past the halfway point no one will react to anything visually again. 

The background CG is horribly limited too. For instance, in one scene everyone starts commenting how it's night time and the fireworks going off are beautiful. There's no firework CG, no firework effects, no firework sounds, and the background is still bright with a blue sky like it's 1 PM. In another scene, you're supposedly in the gym showers getting mud and sweat off of yourself....and the background shows you in the school's entrance, by the shoe lockers. What?

Art isn't the only type of asset lacking in this game. There's no audio. The only sound you get is the repetitive soundtrack, which seems as limited as the Art in variety as well. Inappropriate music plays several times, setting a mood that doesn't reflect the text in the slightest. 

And then just like that, the game's over. After nothing happens for an hour, you suddenly choose one of the girls and, if you chose to hang out with them a lot, you end up marrying her. It's bad. It's literally "Which do I choose?" [Hoshi] [Selina]. Oh, and [Lea] is only an option if you answered the first decision in the game correctly. Yes, the best route (with most of the CG and noteworthy scenes) is completely locked out if you express dismay at the idea of crossdressing to stay in the school. If you go full weeaboo and express some interest in crossdressing, Lea hops all over you. her route is the only one that's got any entertainment value in it, and I only enjoyed it because I could skip all the scenes without her, as I'd already completed most of the game at that point.

I unlocked all 18 event CG and had seen all scenes in this game, while streaming, in 2:41:00. This game is short, shallow, and unimaginative. It doesn't even play with its premise. By all means, send it as a gag gift to people. That's how I got it. But for your own sake, don't buy it and expect even a passable time. I'm surprised that the developers canceled their kickstarter to develop this privately; it really feels like they'd put something out just to say they did it. Even Katawa Shoujo is leaps and bounds ahead of this one.

review: The game is actually very good. The artstyle is very nice, although there isn't too much animation to go along with it. The game has multiple endings, I haven't seen all of them, though I feel it is about two for each girl. There is the good ending and the bad ending for each. Sadly I apparently made all of the wrong choices (while thinking i was actually doing pretty well) and wound up getting the bad endings for both Hoshi and Selina. The bad endings are actually pretty sad, and after a couple hours of playing, and becoming invested in the main character, Shoji, I was actually sad for him. Although it wasn't the type of despaire sadness, more of a "I feel bad for you, but we'll do better next time!" kind of sadness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135968267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1450843011}
review: This is a cute highschool romance love story. There are three different girls you can end up with or you can end up alone. So to put it simply you have three good endings and one bad one. Depending on your chooses, will depend on what girl you get, But this game is rather simle and usually only has one or two options to pick from when making a decision. If you want a game that will challenge your relationship skills and romancing skills then this isnt the game for you. If you just want a quick romatic and cute love story about a cross dressing teen guy then, I say this might be the game for you :3  If you arn't tht serious about buying the game then I would highly suggest waiting for it to go on sale, but if the game really intrests you then go ahead and buy it. I personally would buy this game at most maybe 10$, anything more I think is too pricy for this game. It has a cute story that is mostly predicatable and to get through all the endings took me like max two hours. But over all I would define the game as a quick and cute romance story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013857165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1453811796}
review:
Ok.... Highschool Romance, You play as a Dude called Shoji, who was accidentally Enrolled into a All girls collage for your final year of collage, due to an error on your forms saying you are female. but instead of leaving and ruining the year for entry exams the Principle, called Lea, has come up with the idea fo you to dress up as a girl so you can "blend in" and complete the final year. (the reason he changed collage is that him and his family travel alot)

So around the collage you meet 2 Girls who slowly become your friends, one is Hoshi, who is a quiet timid "book worm" who is the Class rep in you classroom, and then you meet Selina, who is a busty, bashful sporty type. things happen and you are caught up into a "love net" between the 2 girls.

i wont spoil the ending but its really Heartwarming, and there is a third "woman" you can fall in love with.

ive had 0 hours when i wrote this but i watched about 3 playthroughs of this game and it took my heart....

Ok, that was creepy O-O''

But if you are looking for 'cartoon porn' if you are from THAT crowd, then you should skip this game as this game has no nudity whatsoever.

Other than finding the hidden character and having it being "xxxxxx - I'm not ruining this game but take a wild guess who it is?", there is nothing about this game that I would be offended about to play with my parents and I highly suggest the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039337300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1450301410}
review:
Played through and got the Selina ending. It's a cute game with stylish art, the characters look great. But it's pretty short. You can play through it in about one two-hour session, which isn't including the different endings of course.

Something else that bothered me were the static characters. There aren't a great many expressions for them, and this clashes with the dialogue and intended emotion of the scene more than once. There are visual novels out there that do this better, but it's never really jarring, just disappointing.

Also, I would have liked it better with adult content. Not sure if they left that out because of Steam or aesthetic decisions, but there is no 18+ version of the game.

I'd recommend waiting for a sale, but if you have the money to blow I defs recommend it. Very cute characters with fun personalities. Plus adorable trap boy protagonist, what's not to love?

author: {'steamid': '76561197995820083', 'num_games_owned': 1834, 'num_reviews': 584, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1466121417}
review: Highschool Romance is a dating sim VN with the twist being that the main character is a feminine boy who winds up having to crossdress to attend an all-girls school. It doesn't really go much further than that, unfortunately; the crossdressing is a main element of the story, but it's not played out enough to really satisfy the people who are into that. The story itself is fine as far as typical highschool dating game stories go, but it's not particularly long, and with the skip function you probably won't break 3 or 4 hours between the game's 3 routes. The art style is what will probably make or break it for you; I personally liked it, but I've also seen a lot of people who hate the style due to its more western appearance. Overall it's a decent game for fans of the trap genre, but I was kind of expecting more from it.
